job_description:
About Us:

IntelliEdu is a cutting-edge Australian startup dedicated to revolutionizing education through personalized, AI-driven learning experiences. Since our establishment, we've been committed to leveraging technology to empower students and educators alike. Our mission is to provide innovative solutions that cater to the individual needs of every learner, fostering a lifelong love for learning and ensuring success in a rapidly evolving world.

About the Role:

As a Machine Learning Engineer at IntelliEdu, you'll be at the forefront of developing high-quality data science and ML solutions that drive meaningful outcomes for our clients. Working alongside a team of passionate individuals, you'll have the opportunity to tackle diverse projects and make a real impact in the field of education. From selecting the best technology for specific use cases to building reproducible training pipelines, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of personalized learning.

Responsibilities:

 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative ML solutions
 * Architect and deploy ML applications on cloud platforms
 * Implement MLOps principles to streamline data science workflows
 * Drive pre-sales activities through engaging conversations and proposals
 * Contribute to thought leadership initiatives within the AI/ML community

Requirements for Success:

 * Strong software engineering skills, including CI/CD and TDD
 * Proficiency in Python and cloud engineering
 * Deep understanding of machine learning concepts and development cycles
 * Experience with ML technologies and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
 * Ability to evaluate and implement the best tools for technical challenges

What We Offer:

 * Opportunities for career growth and development in a dynamic startup environment
 * Comprehensive tools and resources to support your success, including a new laptop
 * Flexible work arrangements that prioritize work-life balance
 * Supportive workplace culture that values individual well-being and family needs

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $95,000.00 – $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

 * Gym membership
 * Maternity leave
 * Paid volunteer leave
 * Salary packaging
 * Work from home

Schedule:

 * 8 hour shift

Supplemental pay types:

 * Annual bonus

Work Authorisation:

 * Australia (Required)

Work Location: Remote

WHO WE ARE:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Find out more about us at www.accenture.com.




THE WORK:

This role is influential at its core. You will work with our insurance clients to design and implement AI based decision-making frameworks and models to drive insights for decision making to solve business challenges. In addition to key client relationships, you will also be involved in significant engagement across our business, at multiple levels. You will be someone who can identify opportunities for Data and AI and build capability with key teams internally.

To learn more about our AI Practice please visit- Home | Applied Intelligence Networks (accenture.com)




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

 * You will be part of a diverse, vibrant, global Accenture community, continually pushing the boundaries of business capabilities.
 * At Accenture you will work on meaningful and innovative projects, powered by the latest technologies.
 * Accenture will continually invest in your learning and growth.


HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL NEED

 * Qualifications in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Management, Economics or similar areas
 * 5+ years of experience in deploying AI solutions in analytics-enabled digital transformations.
 * 2+ years in a people management role
 * Demonstrated experience in working with cloud technologies e.g. AWS, GCP or Azure
 * Experience in designing and implementing data & AI solutions.
 * Direct experience owning or leading a project engagement to achieve successful outcomes
 * Strong interpersonal and communications skills to actively engage with clients
 * Ability to Identify opportunities and deliver programs to enhance business processes using data.
 * Driving the adoption of responsible, ethical, regulatory and sustainable practices in development and deployment of artificial intelligence (AI) systems
 * Proactive awareness of emerging technologies, trends, and innovations with data & AI, and its implications in the insurance industry
 * 5+ years of experience in the insurance industry (or related sectors)
 * Understanding of insurance industry specific challenges, regulatory considerations, and trends
 * Progressive expertise in R and/or Python (other scientific languages are advantageous)
 * Due to the nature of work that we perform, candidates need to have valid working rights within Australia (ie. citizenship or Permanent residency)



BONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE

 * Demonstrated experience within management consulting and the ability to effectively advise clients on AI specific solutions is highly desirable
 * Understanding of statistical and mathematical knowledge, tools and techniques to derive insights from data.



WHAT WE BELIEVE

At Accenture, we recognise that our people are multi-dimensional, and we create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.



Our unwavering commitment to inclusion and diversity unleashes innovation and creates a culture where everyone feels they have equal opportunity. Our range of progressive policies support flexibility in ‘where’, ‘when’ and ‘how’ our people work to ensure that Accenture is an organisation where you can strive for more, achieve great things and maintain the balance and wellbeing you need.



We encourage applications from all people, and we are committed to removing barriers to the recruitment process and employee lifecycle. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, disability status, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion or sexual orientation and we do not tolerate discrimination. If you require adjustments to the recruitment process or have a preferred communication method, please email exectalent@accenture.com and cite the relevant Job Number, or contact us on +61 2 9005 5000.



To ensure our workplace is inclusive and diverse we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs. Learn how Accenture protects your personal data and know your rights in relation to your personal data. Read more about our Privacy Statement.

Date: 9 Feb 2024
Job Posting End Date:
Job Country: Australia
Job State/Province: Queensland
Job Location/Region: Brisbane


About BHP


At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.


Come and be a part of this success.


About the Role



 * This role can be based in Brisbane or Perth
 * This vacancy will accept applications until 11:59pm AEST on 25 February 2024.



In this role, you will be responsible for the research and development of innovative decision science digital products. We are looking for a seasoned professional with extensive experience in dynamic simulation, optimisation, machine learning, data analysis and software development.


Reporting to the Decision Sciences manager, your key accountabilities will include:


 * Working on the development of a complex digital solutions for mine planning, supply chain and innovation technology-based initiatives.
 * Shaping and implementing technology / business solutions to contribute to the product development and solve asset opportunities
 * Full life cycle management of software from requirements, planning, design, implementation, delivery and maintenance
 * Design and implementation of a large-scale simulation-, optimisation- and/or machine learning – based algorithms.
 * Research and development of new technologies which will help to contribute to the next generation of advanced mathematical and computer science tools used within the group.
 * Leverage the power of visualisation to communicate business insights that in-turn enable better decisions within our users.

About You



You will be happy working in a fast paced start-up like culture but with the resources of multinational organization can provide.

 * Background in the applied mathematics, computer science or similar quantitative field and experience working on a large scale industrial applications;
 * Senior cross-disciplinary experience in research and development plus experience in managing external contractors;
 * Experience in the development and productionisation of software products and internal tools;
 * Experience in coding in C#, C++, Java, Python etc;
 * Working knowledge in cloud technologies, preferably AWS;
 * Agile experience, including test development;
 * Proven experience working with version control and peer review processes;
 * Experience with relational database systems such as SQLite, MySQL, Postgres, and query language and ORMS such as SQL, LINQ, Entity Framework, DevExpress XPO;
 * Experience developing with DevOps platforms and CI/CD pipelines


About Our Process


At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.
If you are already employed directly by BHP, please log in using your BHP email address or apply via our internal jobs portal.


Supporting a Diverse Workforce

The size, stability and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a best-in-class employee share program. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.


At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that’s more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and recognise that true diversity includes gender, age, race, disability status, sexual orientation, religion, neurodiversity, education levels, and many more aspects of your identity.


BHP is committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.com.

Salary: $170,000 – $180,000:

Exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Lead Data Scientist delivering a very unique and exciting new data product to customers within the Melbourne Market.

Role Description

Exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Lead Data Scientist delivering a very unique and exciting new data product to customers within the Melbourne Market. The position is a full time role based in the Melbourne CBD, offering a competitive remuneration package, flexible working environment and a great company culture where making a positive contribution to social impact utilizing data is part of your everyday working life.
As a Senior Data scientist within the team you will engage with, educate and influence internal business stakeholders to understand and prioritize requirements to design, develop and implement cutting edge analytic solutions to optimize performance. You will be responsible for statistical and machine learning predictive models to help improve customer experiences and increase the company’s data science capability across the business enterprise. As the Senior Data Scientist you will be expected to run and deliver projects autonomously taking responsibility for each assignment, however you will be provided with the full backing and support of a collaborative Global Data Science Team. The perfect candidate will have a degree or PHD in Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science with significant experience of applying machine learning techniques to solve real life problems in a commercial environment using structured and unstructured data.

Essential skills and experience

 * A track record in delivering data science solutions to improve business outcomes
 * Experience in data mining, statistical methods, machine-learning
 * Strong Knowledge of and experience R, SQL and Python;
 * You have strong skills in data wrangling and databases using SQL
 * Experience with Hadoop, Spark or Kafka highly regarded
 * Analytical mind, business acumen, strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra) and problem-solving aptitude
 * Excellent communication and presentation skills
 * Experience in banking and Finance industry is highly desirable



Date Posted:

Posted 4 weeks ago


Expiration date:

March 15, 2024


Location:

Melbourne


Job Title:

Senior Lead Data Scientist

International MineTech organisation backed by a global conglomerate seeking Data Scientist



Your new company

An international MineTech organisation backed by a global Japanese technology conglomerate is seeking a Data Scientist (with a focus on cloud based Machine Learning and Big Data). This role will see you work as part of a new R&D Team at this MineTech’s Australian HQ in Brisbane in a highly funded start up environment akin to Silicon Valley.



Your new role

Established over 25 years ago and headquartered in North America, this MineTech organisation services the technological needs of mining companies throughout the world. With offices in North America and Australia, this organisation's Brisbane based R&D Team who operate in a start up like environment have views for rapid expansion over the next 12-18 months.


From this, your new role as this teams Data Scientist will see you create data focused solutions (initially as prototypes then fully fledged) to gain valuable insights that will affect the operation of mine sites throughout the world. Being this teams data SME, not only will you focus on the ‘science’ of data (algorithms, analytics, AI, etc) but also on its ‘engineering’ (data pipelines, cleansing, sources, etc) with a circa 70/30 split.


With this team working on an IoT and AI based platform to direct, manage and monitor industrial mining assets (trucks, networks, personnel, etc), you will be using cutting edge data science and technology hosted on advanced cloud platforms to conduct your work.


Specifically, you will be specialising within the Machine Learning (ML) and Big Data domains with a focus on predictive modelling and algorithms. From this, your creations will then be transformed into production by a separate team enabling you to continue your R&D focused work. For an insight into future projects, this team is aiming to move from manned assets to fully autonomous vehicles and the creation of the systems behind these.


Regardless of the R&D project, you will be tasked with a variety of responsibilities across both the data science and engineering disciplines (as previous mentioned). These can include deploying Data Pipelines, configuring data visualisation solutions, creating experimental data and technical configurations, designing ML models to produce predictions and writing code for data orientated purposes. Not limited to working just in house, you will also liaise with third parties (e.g. AI start-ups, wearable device manufacturers, etc) to incorporate their data (and systems) into your work.


Whilst based in Brisbane, travel to offices in North America, Japan, etc will be occasionally required throughout your tenure to showcase prototypes, liaise with leadership, witness solutions in situ, etc.



What you'll need to succeed

For this role, you will need experience/knowledge across as much of the following as possible:
 * Machine Learning and Big Data platforms
 * Programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, Java and JavaScript
 * Data and statistical modelling
 * Algorithm development
 * Designing and building high performance data pipelines, warehouses and analytical systems
 * Data mining, cleaning and visualisation
 * Enterprise Data Storage/Lake/Warehousing
 * Cloud based ecosystems (e.g. AWS)
 * Working with data from physical assets (e.g. trains, trucks, cars, etc) and/or mining experience highly advantageous
 * Experience working with both a Start Up and corporate environment highly regarded
 * Working with stakeholders (internal and external) of all levels
 * Perfect communication skills (written and verbal)




What you'll get in return

You will be offered a rare and unique permanent role in Brisbane’s CBD with a highly funded mining technology organisation. This role comes with continual growth, career opportunities, high compensation, flexible working conditions and more.



What you need to do now

If you are interested in this role, click ‘apply now’ or email an up to date resume to Toby.Applegate@Hays.com.au. If this role isn’t quite right for you but you are looking for a new position please do not hesitate to get in touch.

job_title: EOI - Software Developer - The Curtin Institute for Data Science
job_description:
* $99,040 - $106,339 (G07) per annum plus 17% superannuation
 * 2 years fixed term, full-time role with possible extension
 * Support industry demand driven research


Job Reference: 1181299

Curtin Institute for Data Science (former Curtin Institute for Computation)

The Curtin Institute for Data Science (CIDS) is an interdisciplinary knowledge accelerator established in 2016 to meet increasing demand for computational modelling. Our aim is to apply data science and high-performance computing to provide innovative solutions to the real-world problems of government, industry, and academia.

The Institute supports a growing network of SMEs, external organisations, government departments, researchers, co-operative research centres, and not-for-profits across various sectors such as, but not limited to, health sciences, manufacturing, transport, art and culture, astronomy, agriculture, and aquaculture. At present the Institute would typically contribute to 30-40 research projects per annum, working with over 50 external organisations.

Engaging with the Curtin Institute for Data Science means collaborating with a team of specialists who are highly trained in data science, high-performance computing, software development, project coordination and business development. The Institute has a dedicated team of over 30 specialist technical staff with diverse backgrounds in computer sciences, physics, mathematics, computational chemistry and biology, bioinformatics, and remote sensing. It also provides access to over 200 research academics drawn from across Curtin University who specialise in applications of data science in different research settings.

The team is led by Professor Melanie Johnston-Hollitt, a professor of astrophysics, with over 20 years' experience managing multi-disciplinary, international teams.

Your new role

We are seeking detail-oriented software developers to join the Curtin Institute for Computation to work on a multitude of projects across academia, industry, and government. We encourage all skilled front-end, back-end and web developers to submit their EOI.

Responsibilities will include:

 * Assist researchers or business areas to design applications and software for their research and industry applications.
 * Build software tools to assist with data management.
 * Develop tools for integrating annotation data and meta-data and to assist with developing data and meta-data standards.
 * Develop suitable APIs for querying and publishing data.
 * Maintain an understanding of developments in computer hardware, software systems and algorithms where they apply to the relevant discipline.
 * Maintain communication with project partners and stakeholders throughout the duration of assigned projects, to ensure regular exchange of project related information and to initiate appropriate action for issues if they arise.
 * Produce and maintain high-level documentation including but not limited to technical reports, user and developer guides.
 * Design and develop user interfaces and user experiences for web applications including but not limited to dashboards, data visualization, forms and surveys.

To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Paul Hancock, Data Scientist Project Lead, Curtin Institute for Data Science, School of Elec Eng, Comp and Math Sci (EECMS), Faculty of Science and Engineering on paul.hancock@curtin.edu.au.

About us

Curtin University is one of the world’s top 200 universities according to the 2023 QS World University Rankings. We offer a competitive remuneration and benefits package, a friendly and collaborative work environment, generous leave entitlements and superannuation, flexible working arrangements, and salary-packaging. Our vibrant campus includes an art gallery, gym, childcare and medical centre, and a wide range of food options including a supermarket.

For more information about our university, please visit www.curtin.edu.au

Join us!

Please provide a cover letter, your CV and a separate document addressing the selection criteria noted below to allow us to assess your suitability for this role.

Selection Criteria:

 * A qualification in a relevant discipline (computer science, software engineering or data engineering) with considerable relevant experience or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training.
 * Experience and proficiency in software engineering best practice and data quality assurance.
 * Experience with testing frameworks.
 * Ability to deliver software development (or closely related) projects on time and on budget with successful end-user outcomes.
 * Proven skills and a high level of expertise in relevant tools and technologies and the ability to mentor and develop technical skills in fellow team members.

Applications close: 5:15PM AWST, Tuesday 27th February 2024

Applicants should note that prior to appointment, you will need to have a current National Police Records check, undergo character, integrity, and reference checks. Please note that this position may be subject to a WA state government vaccination mandate. If requested, you will be required to provide evidence of your vaccination status prior to employment.

If you have any queries in relation to this application process, please contact our careers team on 08 9266 9000 (option 3,1) or CurtinCareers@curtin.edu.au quoting the Job Reference.

Please note we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies at this time.

company_name: Patterson Cheney Cars and Trucks Pty Ltd
job_description:
* Mercedes-Benz Berwick - #1 Mercedes-Benz Retailer in Australia
 * Join our expert marketing team and take your career to the next level
 * Part of Patterson Cheney, named 2023 VACC Automotive Employer of the Year.


Mercedes-Benz Berwick - #1 Mercedes-Benz Retailer in Australia has a fantastic opportunity for a Data & Marketing Specialist to join our marketing team at Patterson Cheney, one of Australia's largest family-owned automotive businesses, named 2023 VACC Automotive Employer of the Year.

As a Marketing & Data Specialist, you will be responsible for preparing campaign data for sending via electronic direct mail (eDM) on Campaign Monitor & SMS via CellCast for our Retail & Aftersales Business. Your primary focus will be to ensure accurate & targeted data selection, segmentation, & preparation to support our aftersales & marketing campaigns effectively. This role requires a strong understanding of data management principles, excellent attention to detail & the ability to work with various data sources.

Responsibilities:

Data Preparation:

 * Collect, extract, & consolidate eDM & SMS data for our service reminders & retail campaigns
 * From various sources, including CRM systems, online platforms, & external databases, to create comprehensive datasets for campaign sends.
 * Cleanse, validate, & format data to ensure accuracy, consistency, & compliance with privacy regulations.
 * Perform data deduplication & merge processes to maintain a single customer view & eliminate duplicate records.
 * Transform & manipulate data as needed for campaign targeting & segmentation purposes.
 * Conduct quality checks to identify & rectify data anomalies or inconsistencies.

Campaign Targeting & Segmentation:

 * Collaborate with marketing & management to understand campaign requirements, target audience criteria, & segmentation strategies.
 * Apply data selection criteria to create targeted audience segments based on demographic, behavioural & historical data.
 * Test & validate selected segments to ensure accuracy & adherence to campaign goals.

Campaign Data Integration & Synchronization:

 * Interface with the marketing team & IT professionals to establish data integration processes & maintain data synchronization between different systems (e.g., CRM, ERA, DMS, Campaign Monitor, SMS platforms).
 * Troubleshoot data integration issues & work closely with technical teams to implement solutions.

Data Reporting & Analysis:

 * Generate regular reports on data quality, campaign performance, & audience insights to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.
 * Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, & opportunities for optimizing campaign targeting & segmentation strategies.
 * Provide recommendations for data-driven improvements to enhance campaign results & customer engagement.

Qualifications:

 * Automotive experience is preferred, but not necessary.
 * Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Marketing, or a related field (preferred, but not necessary).
 * Experience with Power BI, but not necessary.
 * Proven experience in data management, data preparation, & campaign data handling.
 * Experience with marketing automation platforms (e.g., Campaign Monitor), & data manipulation tools (e.g. Excel) or similar.
 * Familiarity with SMS marketing platforms & eDM best practices.
 * Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets & generate actionable insights.
 * Excellent attention to detail, ensuring accuracy & data integrity.
 * Knowledge of data privacy regulations & best practices
 * Ability to work independently & collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple tasks & deadlines effectively.
 * Strong communication skills, both written & verbal, to effectively interact with cross-functional teams & stakeholders.

Our amazing benefits:

 * Very competitive salary package, with a strong base salary, commissions & superannuation
 * Outstanding career growth opportunities throughout the group
 * Extensive training
 * Access to dealership discounts including, New and Used vehicles, Servicing, Parts, Insurance and Finance
 * Job security with a strong and growing independent family-owned business
 * Employee Assistance Program
 * And above all, lots of support, opportunity & fun

How to Apply:
If you have the right skills and attributes for this position, please apply today by attaching your resume and cover letter, which will be directed to the Talent Acquisition Specialist.

Please note that the successful applicant must undergo a National Police Check.

At Mercedes-Benz Berwick, we believe in fostering a positive & inclusive work environment where our employees can thrive. As a part of our team, you will have access to ongoing training & development opportunities, competitive compensation & attractive benefits.

If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for luxury vehicles, data & marketing, we would love to hear from you. Join our team as a Data & Marketing Specialist & be a part of our success story!

We are an equal-opportunity employer and welcome qualified candidates of any gender, race, religion, or age with the full right to work in Australia. Please note that we will not be considering agency candidates.

company_name: Department of Children, Youth Justice and Multicultural Affairs
job_description:
As the Data Scientist and System Architect you will working closely with the Executive Director and Chief Analyst to define the IT system architecture necessary to support the linkage of multi-agency data to provide Government with comprehensive, system-wide information on how young people interact with multiple justice and human services agencies over time.
The Data Scientist and System Architect will develop system specifications for the data lake, the automated pattern recognition software and ensuring that the data structure, retrieval and analysis needs are met for all participating agencies.

Key Responsibilities:
As the Data Scientist and System Architecture, you will specifically:


 * Develop the system specifications for the data linkage project team
 * Define the IT system architecture necessary to support the data lake, the automated pattern recognition software and ensure that the data analysis needs are met by all participating agencies
 * Provide high-level advice to senior management, managers in other work units, partners and stakeholders on matters related to organisational performance measurement and reporting, and manage organisational information systems or applications
 * Manage the development and maintenance of business intelligence solutions to present data and statistics in an accessible and user-friendly manner for distribution to customers.
 * Oversee performance measurement processes for the provision of accurate, reliable and appropriate data to meet the requirements of decision-makers, managers and planners at departmental, State and Commonwealth government levels.
 * Network and collaborate across teams to ensure data and analytics solutions are consistent with standards across Data and Analytics and meeting the needs of Departmental users.
 * Ensure team members can access and use data analysis tools and processes and procedures are current and transferable.
 * Contribute to the development of a corporate culture, which is client-focused and values innovation and continuous improvement

Applications to remain current for 12 months.This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia License.

Company Description


Presien is an AI vision company solving real heavy industry challenges, from quality assurance and control to security and safety. Presien improves how heavy industry goes to work.


Job Description


Depending on your skills, experience and interests, you could be working on any of the following:

 * Maintain and improve our datasets, including through the continuous development of our active learning pipeline
 * Refine and debug our MLOps pipelines and repositories
 * Work on detection model and pipeline issues reported in the field and implement solutions
 * Maintain and develop code for dataset generation and maintenance, model training, and evaluation and testing
 * Maintain and develop code for our detection pipeline
 * Develop novel AI/ML and computer vision solutions for new features and products

Please note that applicants MUST have an existing, valid visa to work in Australia. Sorry, but we are unable to sponsor overseas applicants at this stage.


Qualifications


Must haves

 * Existing, valid visa to work in Australia. Sorry, we are unable to sponsor overseas applicants at this stage
 * Extensive hands on machine learning and deep learning experience
 * Good knowledge of deep learning, neural networks, machine learning, and related mathematical fields
 * Experience with one or more common machine learning frameworks used for deep learning (e.g PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc…)
 * Computer vision and image processing experience with application in ML (e.g. working with OpenCV, training image classification/object detection models, etc…)
 * Very comfortable working on Linux systems, especially on the command line
 * Experience with shell scripting
 * Solid Python knowledge, including the standard library, numpy and other ML related packages
 * Very comfortable with Git
 * Minimum bachelor level degree in a relevant field
 * Demonstrable experience of the above skills and knowledge (2 years minimum); e.g. working in industry, academia, master’s degree by research, or PhD.
 * Self-motivated with an autonomous work ethic

Preferred

 * Experience with working in a ML production environment (MLOps)
 * R&D and/or research experience
 * Experience using docker
 * Experience using GPU accelerated cloud instances for training
 * Experience preparing machine learning pipelines for lower power embedded systems (e.g. Nvidia Jetson)
 * Some software development experience

Nice to have

 * Experience with the following specific tools: Pytorch, TensorRT, DVC
 * C/C++ experience
 * AWS experience, specifically EC2

job_title: Senior Research Scientist, Google Research, Machine Learning Efficiency
job_description:
At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

 * PhD in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
   
 * 7 years of experience in Machine Learning (ML), ML Efficiency, ML Optimization, or a related field.
   
 * Experience contributing to research communities including publishing in forums (e.g., ICML, ICLR, NeurIPS, or related).
   
 * Experience with programming languages (e.g., Python or C/C++).



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

 * Experience in innovative research.
   
 * Experience working with a research team.
 * Ability to effectively navigate ambiguity.
 * Excellent coding skills.
   


ABOUT THE JOB

As an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

Our team is committed to advancing in the areas of efficient architectures, training efficiency of foundational models, data efficiency, and inference efficiency. You will have opportunities to collaborate with Google teams over the world and advance in the above mentioned areas, enable fundamental breakthroughs, and pioneer next-generation products.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 * Develop fundamental advances in algorithms and foundational model architectures that improve the speed of training and generalization of deep learning models.
 * Develop fundamental advances to make inference with foundational models more efficient and flexible including knowledge adoption and distillation techniques.
 * Work on data subset selection and more efficient ways to train with large data sets.
 * Improve entire model deployment pipeline including better formulations for pretraining, instruction and tuning, and Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF).

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Company Description


Keywords Studios is one of the largest go-to technical and creative services providers to the global video games industry. We provide integrated art production, engineering, audio services, testing, localization, and player support services for PC, Playstation, Nintendo, Xbox video games. How big are we? 17,000 employees. 80+ Studios. 20+ Countries. EUR$650M+ Revenue. Best of all, we continue to grow in a sustainable way.

Keywords Studios Australia, consists of Wicked Workshop (Vic), Tantalus Media (SA, Qld, Vic), and Mighty Games. In 2023 we added over 70 new, talented individuals surpassing 250 employees in Australia. We're anticipating similar growth for 2024. Whilst we're backed by a highly successful parent company, we still enjoy the intimacy and independent studio feels. If you're a passionate, collaborative, can-do, delivery focused individual, we'd love to hear from you.

This position is with our Mighty Games Studio based in Fitzroy, Victoria.

Founded in 2013, Mighty Games’ experienced team focuses on developing proprietary AI-based technology solutions for the video game industry. The studio has developed a platform of scalable, artificial intelligence led, automated, build and testing tools optimized for game development pipelines. Mighty is currently running thousands of hours of automated testing per day on client titles across a range of mobile games, console titles, multiplayer and cross-play games in a variety of genres.


Job Description


Mighty Build and Test, A Keywords Studio, are currently recruiting for a Graduate Machine Learning Programmer in game development to work with a growing team of enthusiastic and collaborative engineers. We specialise in creating tools to accelerate and empower game developers. In particular, our tools assist in automating the build and deployment processes of games creation as well as automated Quality Assurance testing.

The role of Machine Learning Engineer at Mighty Build and Test is a technical role where you'll work with the existing Build and Test suite of tools and develop new multi-modal technologies to further expand our capabilities. This role while at Mighty Build and Test, you can expect to:

 * Collaborate with a diverse range of specialist engineers and contribute to knowledge sharing and research in emerging disciplines within game development.

 * Work with Multi-Modal Machine Learning technologies to analyse game-states and respond with simulated player-input.

 * Work with a wide range of partner teams and help them create the best possible games across mobile, desktop, console and VR/AR projects from Indie to AAA.

 * Work Remotely! While many of our team work from our Melbourne office, we also have team members in most Australian cities and remote teams overseas. Work wherever suits you best.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

The responsibilities of the Machine Learning Engineer at Mighty Build and Test can be broken down into the following core areas

Development

 * Build expert knowledge of Mighty Build and Test's existing AI Technologies, and work with other engineers to identify new opportunities for Machine Learning in the testing pipeline.

 * Experiment with Reinforcement and Imitation Learning models that allow AI to play games and identify defects with a focus on robustness and minimization of model re-training.

 * Prototype new Machine Learning technologies within the studio, and help identify and establish examples that can be built upon by other team members.

 * Share knowledge about emerging Machine Learning technologies and their applicability to games testing or defect identification / categorization.

 * Integrate testing system APIs into Unity, Unreal and C++ engine games.

 * Create bespoke API functions where required for specific titles and testing use-cases.

 * Adapt, test and document changes to API systems where required.

 * Write or update code for existing internal toolsets to expand testing AI capability needed to support new feature requests from clients.

 * Write and update internal documentation for new features, processes and client requirements.

 * Test and provide feedback on tools and development features developed by other members of the Mighty Build and Test team.

General

Providing general assistance, guidance and support to all areas of the business by;

 * Attending Team Weekly Ops and Individual Performance Meetings

 * Keeping abreast of daily/ weekly departmental priorities

 * Documenting work done in internal ticketing tools

 * Assisting with staff training if required




Qualifications


DEMONSTRATED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

 * Bachelor's Degree or minimum Three Years' Experience in Software Engineering, Games or related Industry.

 * Proven experience working with Machine Learning technologies in some capacity.

 * Solid experience coding in Python, C++, CUDA or similarly relevant languages.

 * Robust understanding of game development genres, mechanics and development practices.

DESIRABLE SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

 * Experience working on game projects.

 * QA, CI/CD, Production or other skillsets.

 * Ability to write code in C# and/or Lua.


Additional Information


If you'd like to know more about Keywords Studios we recommend visiting our corporate site HERE

Should you wish to discuss Keywords Studios and our opportunities prior to making an application please feel free to call our Head of Talent Acquisition, Stan Rolfe on +61 416 048 976. Leave a message and he'll return your call as soon as possible. Please note Stan is based in Perth, Western Australia.

Company Description


Let’s create a more sociable future together

At Endeavour, we’re totally into what we do. With a portfolio that includes Dan Murphy’s, BWS, ALH Hotels, Pinnacle Drinks and more, we love to bring people together. Together we share our passion for our products and industry; it’s what inspires us to dream big, and continue to create new experiences for our customers and teams across Australia. If you thrive on positive energy, we want to meet you!


Job Description


You’re driven by a customer mission and passionate about being part of a tribe of great people. Whatever you love - design, technology, engineering, you’re active in the community that sits around it.

With a growth mindset, you orient around doing what’s meaningful, purposeful and delivers value. You’re excited about being part of digital transformation and disrupting one of Australia’s biggest companies.

You’re curious and empathetic, with an eye for the bigger picture. You deal with complexity by collaborating with colleagues, listening to customers, testing ideas and continuously learning. You take authorship for what you create.

Sound good? Read on.

Here is a taster of what you can expect in this role:

 * Provide thought leadership on industry best practice regarding data science solutions and their implementation in business.
 * Prepare strategic team direction and provide roadmaps for long term ML and AI capabilities
 * Provide strategic input to the business on opportunities for value growth using data science
 * Identify and assess the internal and external partnership opportunities and lead the organisation in data-related conversations and negotiations.
 * Leading projects and building relationships with internal teams to identify questions, issues and opportunities for data analysis and experiments.
 * Build the capability of the team through leadership, coaching, development and performance management
 * Work out which building blocks will be needed, how they will interface with each other and with other parts of the technology stack, and how the critical components will actually work
 * Work with our data engineering and technology teams to identify the right big data infrastructure to support our future ambitions
 * Engage with business partners and delivery teams to ensure algorithms are delivered and implemented into production systems
 * Interpret analysis and modelling results in a business context and provide specific recommendations for new types of content to be developed.
 * Lead a team of data scientists to:
 * Understand the important dimensions of the variants that the business is seeking to test
 * Build the system to make the choices, learn what worked and make better choices in future
 * Develop and maintain state of the art advanced statistical and machine learning models
 * Be responsible for the end-to-end data science execution including scoping, building, testing, implementation, maintenance, tracking and optimisation of predictive models on the GCP platform.
 * Be responsible for complete and accurate documentation of all development.


Qualifications


Now let’s talk about you:

 * Lead a team of Data Scientists to deliver solutions at scale for Advanced Analytics
 * 7 to 10 years experience developing predictive models in commercial environments, preferably exposure to merchandising and Marketing.
 * Experience in developing machine learning algorithms to drive class-leading commercial outcomes.
 * Proven commercial experience in statistical and machine learning modelling, with experience in deploying models in production on the cloud.
 * Advanced working knowledge of analytical programming: Python (preferred) or R, and SQL.
 * Exposure to Data Warehouse platforms, such as BigQuery
 * Experience with SQL essential; exposure to Azure or GCP preferred.
 * Experience in working in complex, multi-stakeholder environments.
 * Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
 * Comfort with qualitative segmentation approaches and an ability to translate this into actionable features and tests
 * Ideally experience in retail vertical markets (not essential)
 * Tertiary qualified in relevant disciplines (Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science). Prior experience in a commercial/business support or data/insights analyst role coupled with relevant tertiary qualifications.

The benefits are good too!

 * We offer flexible working in every sense
 * An exclusive discount card for BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Woolworths, BIG W and other Endeavour Group brands, including our ALH pubs
 * Monthly meeting-free days
 * Your health and wellbeing is your most important asset, and as one of our valued team members, it’s our first priority. You will have a range of free services to help you live well and support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing
 * Endeavour Group is full of opportunities - use our dedicated learning and development options to grow an idea, yourself, and your career. This is just the start, so dream big.

At Endeavour, we value being a workplace where everyone’s welcome - if you meet a number of the requirements (and not all), we encourage you to apply.


Additional Information


We are together creators

With a portfolio that includes Dan Murphy’s, BWS, ALH Hotels, Pinnacle Drinks and more, Endeavour Group is big on sociability. Together we create the moments that bring millions of people together. And together we have more fun, create more opportunities, and score a lot more goals. We’re serious about creating a safe, inclusive and fun place to rock up to where equal opportunity is key, and flexibility is part of how we roll.

We’re all about creating a more sociable future - for our customers and each other. If this job excites you - and you’re close-enough on the requirements, reach out, we’d love to hear from you.

You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or at endeavourgroupcareers.com.au.

Our Talent Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Endeavour Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job no: 522559
Work type: full time
Location: Sydney, NSW
Categories: Post Doctoral Research Associate, Senior Research Associate

 * Join a world-class team at the cutting edge of technology, focussed on making quantum computers a reality
 * Collaborate with a diverse, multicultural team across the full stack quantum computer
 * Enjoy the sunny shores and stunning scenery of Sydney, Australia

The Quantum Machine Learning Scientist works within a truly multi-disciplinary team of scientists and engineers at the forefront of atomic electronics and quantum computing internationally, funded by Silicon Quantum Computing Pty Limited (SQC) and based at UNSW Sydney.

This role will work closely with hardware, software and processing engineers to realise quantum processors in silicon ensuring high-fidelity control and measurement of multi-qubit devices at cryogenic temperatures. The Quantum Machine Learning Scientist will develop different machine learning protocols, including reservoir computing, extreme learning machines and kernel methods, for near-term implementations of both analogue and digital quantum computers. They will use SQC’s analogue quantum devices, comprised of large arrays of phosphorus-doped silicon quantum dots, as a computational resource to solve certain well-defined computational tasks to demonstrate potential advantage over classical computational methods. Additionally, this role will develop machine learning models for digital quantum computers focusing on protocols that can be implemented with a 100-qubit silicon-based quantum processor, as the broader SQC team works to scale quantum devices from 10-qubit to 100-qubit architectures within the next 5 years. Where necessary, this role will assist with the support and supervision of PhD and undergraduate students and other members of the Algorithms and Architectures team members.

The Quantum Machine Learning Scientist will report to Dr Casey Myers, the Algorithms and Applications team lead, and also work closely with Associate Professor Charles Hill, the Quantum Architectures team lead, alongside other staff and students funded by SQC.



About the role

 * Fixed Term – 3 years
 * Full-time (35 hours per week)

Background

 * SQC is an Australian research and development company, with the specific aim of building a quantum computer based on atom qubits in silicon.
 * SQC is a well-funded Australian company formed by the Commonwealth Government, the New South Wales State Government, Commonwealth Bank of Australia, Telstra, and UNSW Sydney.
 * SQC is seeking to commercialise silicon quantum computing technology developed in Australia – technology that has the potential to have a global impact.
 * SQC’s work is building on more than 20 years of world-leading research by the Centre of Excellence which includes the development of dedicated manufacturing and measurement techniques for an atom-based quantum computer in silicon.
 * This role and SQC are located at the headquarters of the Centre at UNSW Sydney.

Specific responsibilities for this role include:

LEVEL A:

 * Develop quantum machine learning models with near-term quantum systems.
 * Design and implement machine learning protocols with analogue quantum systems using near-term arrays of phosphorus-doped silicon quantum dots.
 * Design and implement machine learning protocols with digital quantum algorithms on near-term, atom-based silicon hardware.
 * Adapt, tailor, and develop quantum machine learning protocols for industry focussed applications.
 * Work on the theory of quantum machine learning to determine when/how a quantum advantage can be achieved for both analogue and digital quantum computing.
 * Work with a multidisciplinary team of quantum physicists, engineers, technicians, postdoctoral researchers, and PhD students for early-stage quantum system implementations on silicon-based quantum computer devices.
 * Generate high quality research publication output.
 * Provide technical assistance and training to the research staff and students working within SQC.
 * Align with and actively demonstrate the UNSW Values in Action: Our Behaviours and the UNSW Code of Conduct.
 * Cooperate with all health and safety policies and procedures of the university and take all reasonable care to ensure that your actions or omissions do not impact on the health and safety of yourself or others.

LEVEL B:
(in addition to the above)

 * Make significant contribution to the field of quantum machine learning.
 * Where appropriate, take leadership of research projects.
 * Supervise honours or other higher degree research students

About the successful applicant
(Selection Criteria)

To be successful in this role you will have:

LEVEL A:

 * A PhD in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant field, with work experience in a research or commercial environment.
 * Demonstrated experience in classical machine learning techniques, with expertise in reservoir computing, extreme learning machines or kernel methods.
 * Demonstrated research capabilities in quantum machine learning or a related field.
 * Experience writing high-performance quantum algorithm implementation, preferably in Python, MATLAB, C/C++, or equivalent. GPU programming and/or high-performance computing experience.
 * Experience with Python quantum computing packages such as OpenQASM (Qiskit), Cirq, Project Q, or equivalent.
 * Experience in troubleshooting and solving complex unplanned issues.
 * Well-organised, attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines.
 * High level written and verbal communication skills and the ability to network effectively and interact with a diverse range of students and staff.
 * Demonstrated ability to work in a team, collaborate across disciplines and build effective relationships.
 * An understanding of and commitment to UNSW’s aims, objectives and values in action, together with relevant policies and guidelines.
 * Knowledge of health and safety responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training.

LEVEL B:
(in addition to the above)

 * Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research in machine learning or quantum algorithms with a track record in research with outcomes of high quality and high impact with clear evidence of the desire and ability to continually achieve research excellence as well as the capacity for research leadership.
 * Demonstrated significant experience in classical machine learning techniques, with expertise in reservoir computing, extreme learning machines or kernel methods.
 * Demonstrated outstanding research capabilities in quantum machine learning or a related field.
 * Experience solving problems with machine learning on quantum systems.
 * Experience modelling qubit systems.
 * Significant experience with Python quantum computing packages, such as OpenQASM (Qiskit), Cirq, ProjectQ, or equivalent.
 * Experience with co-supervision of higher degree research students in quantum computing.

You should systematically address the selection criteria listed within the position description in your application.

Please apply online - applications will not be accepted if sent to the contact listed.

Contact:
Casey Myers
E: casey.myers@unsw.edu.au

Applications close: February 26th, 2024

This position sits within our MRT arm of the business- we transport over 30 million tonnes per annum within our Iron Ore and Lithium operations and are proud to be moving towards a world first in autonomous road trains.

Digital Resources is at the forefront of data science, working with some of Australia's biggest companies to fill such roles as data analyst, data engineer, and senior data scientist. We can find positions suitable for your skillset and do much more quickly than the average independent job search. You might think of us as providing the entrance you need to land that dream role.


Job searching can be a taxing and slow process. ﻿
This is where Digital Resources can be a valuable partner in your job search. Rather than unthinkingly submit your CV to companies, we use a targeted approach and pair you with organisations looking specifically for your skills. We even help find roles with such potential benefits as:


 * Flexible work hours
 * Mentorship and training
 * Remote working
 * Latest technology environments

At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

 * PhD in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
   
 * 7 years of experience in NLP, NLU, Machine Learning, LLMs, or a related field.
   
 * Experience contributing to research communities including publishing in forums (e.g. ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, EACL, COLING, ICLR, AAAI, NeurIPS).
   
 * Experience with programming languages (e.g. Python or C/C++).



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

 * Experience in innovative research.
   
 * Experience working with a research team.
   
 * Ability to effectively navigate ambiguity.
   
 * Strong coding skills.
   


ABOUT THE JOB

As an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

In this role, you will work on multi-lingual natural language processing for low resource languages. This project aims to develop multi-lingual LLMs for South East Asia, and their application to translation and semantic understanding tasks. You will build several existing/in-development datasets, and also construct several additional resources, including multimodal text and audio. You will create novel evaluation datasets, compile and create new datasets, and develop algorithms for LLM training and evaluation.


Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 * Design algorithms for model training and prediction.
 * Manage experiments on TPU cloud.
 * Write up results in design documents, technical reports, and papers for publication.
 * Propose new research ideas and provide research leadership in the team.
 * Program in python with JAX, PAX.

About the role:

company_name: St John of God Health Care
job_description:
Your role at St John of God Health Care

You will be responsible for developing and implementing analytics solutions to uncover patterns, predict trends, and derive meaningful insights that drive positive outcomes for patients, caregivers, and the organisation, supported by the Group Manager Advanced Analytics and the Senior Data Scientist.

The position also support Business Intelligence and self-service tool development using tools such as Power BI, with a human-centred design approach and user experience (UX) mindset.

You will collaborate with data engineering teams and other Analytics and IM Teams to deploy analytical solutions into production environments.

The Position
 * Design and create interactive dashboards to communicate complex data insights in an accessible and self-service manner using visualization tools such as Power BI.
 * Develop and maintain standardized reporting templates that promote self-service reporting.
 * Create clear and compelling visualizations (charts, graphs, dashboards) to effectively communicate insights and findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 * Ensure appropriate testing has occurred, all change control procedures are met and all changes are documented.
 * Work collaboratively with business users to understand their requirements and provide analytical support for strategic and operational initiatives.
 * Help the business understand data-driven insights to improve the quality of business decision making.
 * Apply statistical analysis to identify patterns, correlations, and trends within large and multi-dimensional datasets.
 * Use cases may include developing and implementing machine learning algorithms for predictive and prescriptive analytics.
 * Work with the data engineering team to build structured datasets suitable for predictive analysis and modeling.
 * Collaborate with data engineers to ensure good data quality, integrity and availability.
 * Continuously improve model performance through experimentation and iteration.
 * Managing SJGHC’s clinical costing process as well as being the main point of contact for case mix data and health funding issues.


You will have demonstrated expertise in health data analysis, revenue modelling and benchmarking with a deep understanding of health section dynamics. You will have strong skills in programming languages commonly used for data analysis, such as Python, R, or SQL, knowledge of tools like Excel, Tableau, Power BI, or other data visualization platforms.

You will also have some exposure to the application of machine learning algorithms techniques and libraries along with proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, including experience with statistical analysis, data visualization, and data mining to extract insights from complex healthcare datasets.

To succeed you will possess a tertiary qualification in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics Statistics or other quantitative discipline. It is highly desired if you have experience and knowledge in healthcare funding.

Above all, people will be at the core of everything you do committing to and supporting our Mission and Values.

We can offer you
 * Competitive salary and benefits
 * Permanent full time position working 76 hours a fortnight
 * Based at our Melbourne office with 40% work from home option
 * Salary packaging up to $18,550 on a range of benefits such as mortgage, rent, meal entertainment, holiday accommodation or other everyday living expenses as well as options to salary package benefits above the FBT cap on items such as:
   * Novated leasing
   * work related expenses
   * self-education and
   * additional superannuation
 * A healthy work-life balance through flexible work options, additional purchased leave and well-being programs
 * Employee discount on St John of God Hospital & Medical Services and Private Health Insurance
 * Employee support through our dedicated free Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
 * Access to a range of Lifestyle, Health & Wellbeing rewards and discounts
 * Central location close to public transport


For enquiries contact Mark Gu, Group Manager Advanced Analytics on 0403 359 327

St John of God Health Care embraces diversity and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and people with disabilities. job_title: Research Fellow - Automation and Data Science Engineer / Scientist
job_description:
The Opportunity

The Department of Chemical and Biological Engineering located within the Faculty of Engineering is seeking applications for a Research Fellow - Automation and Data Science Engineer / Scientist.

The Research Fellow will manage a new automated research platform (High-Throughput Energy Materials Discovery Platform – HEMP). The platform is dedicated to the discovery of new energy materials and funded by the Australian Centre for Advanced Photovoltaics and other major stakeholders such as Monash University, CSIRO and ANFF.

The funding was awarded to researchers at ACAP’s Monash University node and the instrument will be located at the Melbourne Centre for Nanofabrication. The platform is a 10-meter-long robotic system which combines all aspects of a modern materials development laboratory for solution processable (printable) semiconductors.

The highly motivated individual will take responsibility for the automation and data management aspects of this research tool. This represents a unique stepping stone for academic as well as professional careers.

The successful candidate will have research or work experience in the field of automation, data science or mechatronic. Ideally this includes the software and/or hardware integration of scientific equipment. Experience in successfully supervising, mentoring and coaching to support the development of research staff and/or a demonstrated trajectory of leadership capability.

Diversity is one of our greatest strengths at Monash. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse people, people with disabilities, neurodiverse people, and people of all genders, sexualities, and age groups.

Be part of our story. Work with us to #ChangeIt.

Monash avidly supports flexible and hybrid working arrangements. We have a range of policies in place enabling staff to combine work and personal commitments more easily.

Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to 'How to apply for Monash Jobs'.

Your employment is contingent upon the satisfactory completion of all pre-employment and/or background checks required for the role, as determined by the University.

Enquiries

Please address your application to Professor Udo Bach, Professor in the School of Chemical and Biological Engineering

All Enquiries please email, Ana Amaral Ferreira on ana.amaralferreira@monash.edu

Job Description

Lead Data Scientist - Financial Company




Are you an exceptional Data Scientist with a passion for finance and a knack for uncovering valuable insights from complex datasets? Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to lead a team of talented data scientists and drive innovation in a renowned financial company? If so, we have the perfect role for you!




Company Overview




Our customer is a leading player in the financial industry, dedicated to providing innovative solutions and cutting-edge technology to their clients. With a strong focus on data-driven decision-making, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics to enhance our business strategies and deliver superior results.




Lead Data Scientist




As the Lead Data Scientist, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven transformation, responsible for leading a team of skilled data scientists and driving the development and implementation of advanced analytics solutions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to extract valuable insights from complex financial data, enabling evidence-based decision-making across the organisation.




Responsibilities




 * Lead a team of data scientists, providing guidance, mentorship, and fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.

 * Develop and execute data science strategies to address complex business challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques and algorithms.

 * Design and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and statistical analyses to uncover patterns and trends in financial data.

 * Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify data requirements and develop actionable insights and recommendations.

 * Drive the adoption of best practices in data analysis, data visualisation, and data management within the team and across the organisation.

 * Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and financial technology, identifying opportunities for innovation and improvement.

 * Communicate complex analytical findings to non-technical stakeholders, translating data insights into actionable business strategies.




Qualifications




 * Master's or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.

 * Proven experience in a lead data scientist role, with a strong track record of delivering successful data-driven projects in the financial sector.

 * Deep expertise in machine learning, statistical modelling, data mining, and data visualisation techniques.

 * Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, as well as experience with relevant data science libraries and tools.

 * Strong knowledge of financial concepts, products, and markets, with the ability to translate business problems into analytical solutions.

 * Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and present complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders.




Why join them




 * Opportunity to lead a team of talented data scientists and drive impactful data-driven initiatives.

 * Work in a dynamic and collaborative environment that encourages innovation and professional growth.

 * Access to cutting-edge technology and resources to support your data science endeavours.

 * Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.

 * Join a renowned financial company with a global presence and a commitment to excellence.




If you are passionate about data science, finance, and making a real impact through innovative analytics solutions, we would love to hear from you! Join us in shaping the future of financial services by applying for the Lead Data Scientist role via MAP TALENT today.




Please submit your application and resume to darragh.g@maptalent.com.au or application link

* Permanent fulltime role
 * Sydney based
 * Be part of an expanding organisation

The Company

Purpose Bureau maintains Australia’s largest ESG data bureau, tracking 1000+ activity and ESG insights on every business in Australia. Combining unmatched data assets with subject-matter expertise, they provide solutions to corporates to analyse and track customers and suppliers for Scope 3 reporting and management, Modern Slavery, First Nations and other ESG applications.

Headquartered in Sydney, Purpose Bureau is committed to becoming the ESG data source of truth for corporates and building the largest ESG data and technology asset in Australia.

The Role

The ESG Data Analyst helps Purpose Bureau maintain a competitive edge as an ESG data solutions provider by ensuring that their database and solutions delivered to their clients are accurate and reflect the latest ESG data and trends. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a cutting-edge data asset and provide inputs into how the data, internal processes and solutions can be enhanced.

Key roles and responsibilities


 * Analyse client data and provide guidance to the Data team on any data management and transformations required to deliver ESG insights to Purpose Bureau’s clients.
 * Perform internal assurance on datasets that are included in the Purpose Bureau database, as well as ESG reports and dashboards generated for the client.
 * Interpret standards and frameworks (such as the GHG Protocol and the Partnership for Carbon Accounting Financials) and provide guidance to the Data team to make any required enhancements.
 * Ensure Purpose Bureau’s database and documentation are up to date, including methodologies and basis of preparation.
 * Review current systems and processes to provide process improvement ideas that enhance Purpose Bureau’s ability to automate the generation of ESG insights.
 * Understand and monitor emerging reporting requirements and the sector-specific implications including but not limited to carbon reporting, modern slavery, First Nations, and biodiversity.
 * Support the Head of ESG Data Solutions to work with the Data and Product teams to develop automated or bespoke reporting and dashboard solutions for corporate clients.
 * Provide technical support to clients during their audit process.


About You

You are familiar with ESG topics and enjoy working with ESG data. You are comfortable spending time working through different climate change or modern slavery datasets, tables, charts and graphs to make sure they are accurate. While your primary skillset is managing ESG data, you do not mind shifting gears from time to time to help with other priorities.

From a cultural alignment perspective, you are innovative, entrepreneurial and enjoy operating in an environment where you are required to roll up your sleeves and help the broader team.

Additionally, you will need:


 * A bachelor’s degree in data science, environmental science/engineering, sustainable business, or other quantitative qualifications.
 * At least 3 years’ experience in an ESG-related role. Experience with data management, audit, accounting or reporting will be viewed favourably.
 * Understanding of emerging sustainability trends and reporting requirements.
 * Good interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively as part of a high-performing team.
 * High attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and prioritise workload based on deadlines and priorities.
 * Intermediate to advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint. Knowledge on Excel macros will be helpful but not required.


How to Apply

Apply now by submitting your current CV (in Word format) via our online application process.
For a confidential discussion or to review the information pack, please contact Josh Gill at josh@talentnation.com.au. To be eligible to apply, you must have unrestricted rights to work in Australia.

Talent Nation encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people of all cultures, abilities, sex, and genders.
