Data science is at the heart of Mutinex's product and we are looking for talented Data Scientists to work with our customers data in our Model Scale team.

The work this team does is vital to our business, as you will extract and analyse our customers Marketing, Media and Sales Data and leverage the insights gained to configure our generalised model to surface critical business insights for customers in our core product, GrowthOs.

This means this team isn't doing deep model R&D but managing refreshes, configuring, diagnosing and calibrating models and becoming industry subject matter experts to contextualise model performance to our customers industry nuances.

Mutinex is an early stage SaaS startup that is already working with some of Australia and the world's largest brands.

We have a hybrid way of working with our office a short walk from Central station in Sydney.


The role

You will work alongside our Account Managers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Marketing Scientists to take our latest modelling innovations and apply it to help our customers make effective marketing investment decisions You will collaborate closely with our R&D and Product teams to surface model workflows and feature engineering pipeline improvements.

Your day to day will consist of:

 * Perform exploratory data analysis of a variety of customer and external datasets to understand the customer’s business, surface high-signal data and find opportunities for automating data quality assessments
 * Apply, diagnose and configure our state-of-the-art model to solve our customers problems;
 * Develop expertise in new domains, understanding industry nuances and contextualising model performance.
 * Be a collaborative team member, working with stakeholder teams to improve process and suggest model workflow and feature pipeline improvements

What we are looking for

The key requirements for this role:

 * A minimum of 2 years in similar Data Science, Customer Data Science or Data Analyst roles, preferably in startups or tech companies
 * Proficiency in Python experience with libraries such as Pandas and NumPy
   * Manipulating data
   * Exploratory data analysis
   * Debugging code
 * Proficiency with SQL to be able extract and explore large and complex data sets
 * Experience with git
 * Proven ability to manage multiple projects at once while maintaining a high level of attention to detail as well as communicating deadlines at risk of not being met
 * A strong and proactive communicator, this role is cross functional and plays a key part in ensuring customers are getting value out of our product

The bonus skills and experience we get excited to see:

 * Demonstrable experience with Time series data and models is also preferred while experience with Bayesian statistics/models and Media Mixed Modelling (MMM)
 * Experience engineering new features and building and optimising model workflows (using open-source modelling libraries such as Scikit-Learn, XGBoost or Statsmodels, etc.) to solve business problems
 * Understanding of machine learning principles






About Mutinex

We might be an early stage startup but we already have strong product market fit, household name clients (Samsung, Mars, CUB and ING to name a few) and millions in revenue.

Being early stage means we're also still pretty scrappy and you wouldn't be coming into a well oiled machine, yet. But you would get a lot of opportunity to design, build and oil the machine until it's super oily.

We aren't aiming to be another Tech Unicorn because Unicorns aren't real. We are aiming (and confident of being) more like a real and really big animal that lives for a long time, like a Bowhead Whale.

Mutinex is a startup B2B SaaS platform that provides in-depth data analytics for marketers to better understand their ROI and make better decisions with future spend.


Founded in Australia, we've hit millions in ARR & have seed funding ($5 million in May 2023 & $9.5 million in October 2023 backed by EVP) that we'll use for growing our team to continue to improve our product, bring in new customers and enable them to make better and more informed decisions.

We have a hybrid work environment with teams in Sydney, Melbourne and expanding into the US.

With a team of around 50 people we value high quality communication, strong opinions that are held loosely and people who can give and take feedback well.

Equity (ESOP) is offered to all staff on top of their salary and we also offer additional annual leave after 1 year of tenure (from 20 to 25 days a year) that continues to grow another day each year of service until you max out at 30 days per year.

Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.


At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.


About the team


The AI Products group exists to collaboratively build products that use AI and ML to reduce toil and deliver the right insight at the right time. Working within the Data & Science team, you will join a diverse, globally distributed team of scientists, engineers, product managers, and analysts who help Xero turn data into beautiful, insightful products.


Applied Scientists work cross-functionally with engineers, product managers, and designers to apply AI and ML to deliver seamless product experiences that save time and provide insight – allowing our customers to focus on what matters most. As a staff scientist, you'll be tasked with leading research programs that push the boundaries of what's possible with today's technology.




ABOUT THE ROLE

 * Leading the scientific aspect of cross-functional delivery of AI products, striking a balance between managing delivery risk and pushing the boundaries of what's possible with ML and AI
 * Collaborating closely with ML engineers to manage the growth rate of technical debt and costs across our stack
 * Making sure we're solving the right problems with the right methods
 * Sharing knowledge with colleagues and lifting the bar for the AI Products team
 * Working with teams across Xero to improve the quality and usability of data
 * Building Xero's profile in market through public facing content and events


ABOUT YOU

 * You have 5+ years of experience delivering ML and AI products at scale
 * You are drawn to solving hard problems
 * You are comfortable reading research papers and adapting them to problem at hand
 * You have first hand experience on why it's important to write high quality code from day one, not just when it's time to go to production
 * Constant learning and growth are an important part of who you are


WHAT YOU'LL BRING WITH YOU

 * Ability to translate between the business and machine learning domains
 * Sound software engineering skills in Python, Scala, or similar
 * Expert level hands on practitioner skills in one or more of: time series forecasting, natural language processing, classical machine learning, deep learning
 * Ability to grasp and teach the mathematical concepts that underpin the domains outlined above

Why Xero?
Offering very generous paid leave to use however you’d like (plus statutory holidays!), dedicated paid leave to care for your physical and mental wellbeing as well as an Employee Assistance Program to access mental health care for you and your family, health insurance, life insurance, and income protection, wellbeing and sports programmes, employee resource groups, 26 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, an Employee Share Plan, beautiful offices, flexible working, career development, and many other benefits that reflect our human value, you’ll do the best work of your life at Xero.


Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. Our goal is to make sure you feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.


At Xero we embrace diversity and inclusion and value a #challenge mindset. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single competency or experience . If you are excited about this role, but your past experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be just the right person for this role and Xero. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application and throughout the interview process.

Join the change. Together, we’ll make history.

Job Description:

Bigger vision. Smarter data. Smaller footprint. Welcome to a new era of mining intelligence.

At Veracio, we’re unlocking the value and utility of scarce resources, and it all starts with the orebody. Whether that’s unlocking hard-to-find minerals that are critical for a sustainable future. Or liberating time through the automation workflows from exploration through to production geoscience. Or the workforce, with cloud connected systems keeping the world’s brightest minds at your fingertips. It’s through a fusion of science and technology that we’re helping miners leverage their orebody knowledge to realise more opportunities while mitigating the social and environmental impact of their decisions.

An opportunity is available to join this rapidly growing business as a Data Scientist. The Data Scientist will create and maintain code with a view to streamlining and automating processes. We are looking for someone with strong problem solving and coding skills, familiar with the scientific process and infinitely inquisitive and curious.

Key Competencies:

Ability to code in R and Python along with a proven track record of good coding practice.
Understanding of math/physics/geology/chemistry desirable but not essential.
A background in Statistics and data science preferred.
Fix bugs and addressing issues in legacy code.
Good time estimation and time management skills
Documenting existing architecture and features in legacy code.
Ability to problem solve and be a self-starter. This role requires some self-guidance with very little oversight.
High levels of curiosity.
Team player

A few other things we’re looking for:

Software architecture design.
Data QA/QC.
Testing QA/QC.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science/maths/physics/geology/chemistry.
Background or exposure to geology and geospatial principles is helpful.

Veracio is a wholly owned subsidiary of Boart Longyear with a principal focus on orebody knowledge and technologies for mining. NSW Department of Education has an exciting opportunity for a skilled and experienced individual to join the Chief Data Office team as a Statistical Data Analyst.

About the role




This is an exciting opportunity to help make a difference to the lives of children and young people. In this role, you will be responsible for undertaking complex analysis and the provision of accurate and timely statistical advice to support senior officers. The analysis you are involved in will be used to shape education programs and policies within the department and will contribute to schools understanding the progress of students in key areas of the curriculum.






Benefits



 * Flexible working arrangements, including - work from home arrangements.
 * 35 hour working week
 * Competitive salary, salary sacrificing, employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading
 * Flex Leave entitlements, generous holidays & leave conditions
 * Opportunities for advancement and mobility across the Department to support your career growth




About you




 * Provide conceptual and analytical advice on the analysis and reporting of educational data sets.

 * Respond to requests for data, data analysis, and data interpretation from senior officers, staff and other interested parties.

 * Effectively communicate analysis and results to a wide range of stakeholders and senior audiences using a range of written, verbal and visual methods, and to publication standard.

 * Assist with the preparation of briefings, reports, research proposals and statistical publications for the Minister, Secretary and senior Departmental officers.

 * Engage with stakeholders, including school operations and education services partners, to negotiate and develop analysis plans for emerging educational issues and to support service delivery needs.

 * Knowledge of and commitment to implementing the Department’s Aboriginal Education Policy and upholding the Department’s Partnership Agreement with the NSW AECG and to ensure quality outcomes for Aboriginal people.




Essential requirements of the role




 * Demonstrated understanding of and commitment to the value of public education

 * Tertiary qualifications in statistics or a quantitative discipline, e.g., economics, mathematics, data science, physics, engineering, psychology, and/or relevant professional experience.

 * Demonstrated experience using at least one of the statistical software packages (e.g., R, Stata, SPSS, RUMM), with the expectation of learning and programming in R.

 * A demonstrated understanding, or an appetite to learn up-to-date knowledge of data analysis and statistical methods.

 * Valid Working with Children Check for paid employment.




About the Department of Education

The Department of Education is the largest provider of public education in Australia, with nearly 100,000 employees across NSW in our schools and corporate offices. Our purpose is centred on the delivery of high-quality public education to two-thirds of the NSW student population.




For more information about the Department of Education, please visit NSW Department of Education






How to apply

1. Submit a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the requirements and capabilities of this role

Note: the selection process will include a range of assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role. Successful candidates will be required to undertake pre-employment screening for this role which includes a National Criminal History Check.




This is a child-related role. As a condition of employment you will be required to provide a valid Working with Children Check (WWCC) Clearance number (for paid employment). Visit the website for more information.




Closing date: 19 February 2024 at 11:59pm.

We’re never just satisfied with how things are – because we know how things could be. And it’s our expert Technology team who forge ahead every day to make those ‘what ifs’ a reality.

Suncorp places great importance on leveraging its data to enhance business performance, with the Data Science & AI Centre of Excellence dedicated to optimizing the value derived from data investments. This involves fostering robust business relationships, offering strategic counsel, and facilitating the development of Data Science & AI initiatives, both internally and through external collaborations.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Suncorp, the focus lies on assuming a pivotal technical role in driving the design and implementation of complex Data Science and AI projects aimed at delivering substantial business value. While not a leadership position per se, the successful candidate will possess informal leadership responsibilities, potentially overseeing small offshore delivery teams. The scope of responsibilities encompasses guiding initiatives from prototype development to pilot implementation and ultimately to the integration of fully industrialized and scaled data science assets into core business processes. Additionally, the role carries significant accountability in championing best practice methodologies within the Data Science & AI community, acting as a recognized thought leader, and effectively communicating with key stakeholders to drive impactful outcomes.




What you’ll do

 * Delivery of high-impact Data Science & AI Initiatives, including Generative AI models and Intelligent Process Automation for improved business processes like claims processing and cost optimization in Insurance and Banking
 * Bringing in cutting-edge external Data Science and AI concepts, effective communication across technical and executive audiences, and active participation in industry forums
 * Solving business problems through innovative technical solutions, collaborating with senior stakeholders, and ensuring deployment and scalability of solutions
 * Building strong relationships with senior stakeholders, showcasing value through presentations and prototypes, and illustrating potential impact across the organization
 * Providing insight into emerging AI trends, offering counsel to the Data Science technical job family, and contributing to the Group's Data Science strategy
 * Cultivating a significant industry network, engaging in relevant industry forums, and contributing to the broader Data Science community
 * Measuring success through tangible improvements such as revenue increase, cost reduction, enhanced customer satisfaction, and decreased complaints, while fostering excellence across all initiatives

What you’ll bring

 * 7+ years of experience in Data Science, AI, or closely related disciplines, demonstrating practical expertise and proficiency in the field
 * Bachelor's Degree in a technical field (data science, machine learning, statistics, actuarial, engineering, mathematics, etc.) (mandatory)
 * Experience in developing and implementing Data Science pipelines involving Machine Learning algorithms is mandatory, with desirable experience working on Databricks
 * Knowledge of Generative AI and experience in developing proof-of-concepts or building prototypes using GenAI is desirable
 * Proficiency in Python programming and expertise in developing and optimizing ML pipelines are mandatory qualifications
 * Thorough understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and deep neural networks is mandatory
 * Proven track record of successfully productionizing Data Science solutions and familiarity with advanced tools and technologies such as Databricks and Generative AI




What we can offer

 * A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave, 4 weeks paid secondary carer parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave
 * Discounts and offers on a range of retail favourite stores as well as banking and insurance products
 * Give back to our communities with payroll giving, donation matching and paid volunteer leave
 * Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs; and
 * Prioritise your work/life balance with our robust employee assistance program and dedicated employee council

Acceleration Australia & New Zealand

About us

Acceleration is WPP’s specialist practice for data, analytics & technology consulting. We are a
curious team of highly skilled data and technology practitioners, inspired by experimentation
and new ideas. This is the lifeblood of the future-forward solutions we deliver, that empower
our clients to compete every day, in a dynamic environment. And it is the reason we have
become trusted advisors to CEOs, strategic partners to CMOs, and operational partners to
CIOs, around the globe.

We help clients leverage the power of data, analytics and technology to drive media
effectiveness. With access to expert consultancy services and a deep bench of specialised
skills, we deliver what marketers need to compete effectively, increase efficiency, and drive
growth. We are well known for our open, transparent, and honest relationships with clients. We
identify opportunities for innovation while remaining firmly grounded in business reality. We
demystify complex tasks and impart knowledge without hype or pretence, and we shape
marketing ecosystems to drive growth through the intelligent application of data and
technology. Most importantly, we speak in specifics and get the job done.

The Role

We’re looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join our rapidly growing and
ambitious team.

The Marketing Science arm of Acceleration, a division of WPP, is driving the future of
marketing, and you will affect real business outcomes for our clients. You will work with teams
across the group to provide data-driven insights and solutions that help our clients make more
effective marketing decisions.

You’ll have the opportunity to apply your skills to understand business problems across a wide
variety of industries and deliver meaningful recommendations from data science/econometric
models, which measure how media contributes to sales.

Day-to-day, you’ll be hands-on developing statistical models to support predictive analytics
and deliver non-technical presentations to all levels of the business as well as technical
documentation to the wider team. You will play a central role in mentoring and up skilling our
ambitious and growing team.

Required Experience

 * Candidates will have at least 7+ years’ experience delivering data science and advanced analytics solutions across a range of sectors. Ideally, this experience will be predominately gained working in the advertising and marketing sectors.
 * An advanced quantitative degree in data science, computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or a related data centric field.
 * A strong background in data science, statistical modelling, or econometrics with significant relevant experience providing advanced analytics solutions to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data; as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques
 * Experience in statistical modelling and machine learning techniques (feature engineering, regression, classification, segmentation, cross validation, Bayesian techniques etc.)
 * Excellent presentation skills, distilling complex analysis and concepts into concise business-focused takeaways
 * Strong programming skills in Python &/or R and SQL
 * Proficiency in at least one cloud stack such as GCP, AWS, Azure. GCP preferred.
 * Proficiency in dealing with large datasets




Preferred Experience (desirable but not essential)

 * Practical experience of market mix modelling projects, within the advertising industry
 * Previous experience with Digital Attribution for a media related industry
 * Working knowledge of infrastructure as code tools (i.e. Terraform, CloudFormation) is an advantage.
 * Experience constructing digital reporting dashboards, and strong understanding of digital media and platforms, i.e. ad servers, Facebook, Google Ads, Campaign Manager, DV360, etc.
 * Experience with Tableau, Looker, Datorama and other business intelligence tools.

Join one of the fastest growing tech sectors – Artificial Intelligence!

Make a huge impact in a burgeoning tech industry. VAPAR is a growing company which supports fully remote working! Work from anywhere in Australia. We also have a co-location space in Sydney.

At VAPAR, we're creating a smarter way to keep underground pipes in operation, longer. Piped infrastructure around the world needs to be maintained and repaired in a way that removes the need for long, manual and fatiguing tasks. Currently, there are people who watch hours of video footage of pipe inspections to find issues and have outdated processes to manage their data. We're the team that's changing this.

We turn visual data about every-day pipes directly into condition scores so maintenance and repairs happen faster, cheaper and more accurately.

We're looking for someone mid to senior level who is comfortable taking ownership of their role. In this role, you'll be working within our tech team on our automation technology, creating high performance models and generating insights. As the team grows, you'll have the opportunity to grow with a great team, and we'll support you with the required training to do so. We want you to become a pillar of the team and have a big impact on what we're building at VAPAR.

As a Data Scientist at Vapar, you'll actively contribute to the development of AI-powered solutions that tackle the complex problems associated with pipe and sewer maintenance. Our company culture thrives on innovation, teamwork, respect, and a relentless pursuit of excellence. While enjoying the flexibility of a fully remote position within Australia, you'll collaborate with a diverse team of professionals who share your enthusiasm for cutting-edge technology and its potential to shape a better future for infrastructure management.

Day in the life

We're seeking an experienced and motivated Data Scientist with a solid educational foundation in data science, mathematics, statistics, physics, or similar disciplines. The ideal candidate should be well-versed in software development principles, possess a strong foundation in Python programming, and demonstrate a proven track record in data engineering and model development. In addition to these skills, the right candidate should have a good understanding of deep learning frameworks and be well versed in libraries such as PyTorch and Tensorflow. As a Data Scientist at VAPAR, you'll collaborate with the team to deliver high-quality software solutions that meet customer needs and drive company success.

The Data Scientist role entails a comprehensive engagement with machine learning and data modelling processes, including:

 * Utilising Deep Learning, Machine Learning, and Statistical Modelling techniques to create and refine various algorithms, including regression, classification, detection, and recognition models.
 * Playing a pivotal role throughout the entire machine learning model lifecycle, which encompasses data analysis, pre-processing, modelling, optimisation, and ongoing monitoring.
 * Enhancing the scalability, stability, accuracy, speed, and overall efficiency of our existing machine learning infrastructure and workflows.
 * Crafting and managing scripts for efficient data extraction, data management, and model training.
 * Designing and executing innovative experiments within machine learning and data pipeline frameworks to proactively discover and address any performance bottlenecks.
 * Diligently monitoring machine learning model performance, swiftly identifying, and troubleshooting issues, and deploying effective solutions to maintain and improve model accuracy.
 * Streamlining ML processes and data annotation tasks through the automation of repetitive routines.
 * Effectively communicating/ documenting complex modelling techniques, experimental strategies, and outcomes to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clarity and actionable understanding.

Must-have skills

On day one we'll expect you to have…

 * Bachelor or Master degree in data science, mathematics, statistics, physics, or other related fields (or equivalent work experience).
 * 2+ years of professional experience in Python software development and its libraries, especially in the context of data analysis and machine learning.
 * Strong research skills with the ability to dig through deep learning literature and translate this into viable use cases.
 * Hypothesis driven approach for constant and incremental development of a large-scale model system.
 * Experience in SQL for data extraction and analysis.
 * Hands-on experience in Pandas, Numpy, TensorFlow/Keras.
 * Excellent communication skills.

Desirable skills to have..

 * Proficiency in Databricks is greatly valued
 * Strong proficiency in PySpark
 * Hands-on experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load)
 * Familiarity with Microsoft Azure, particularly with Azure Machine Learning Studio
 * Advanced commercial analytical abilities for extracting insights and driving business outcomes from complex datasets

Selling points

 * Flexible working hours with ability to work remotely
 * Work with a driven, fun and switched on team that likes to raise the bar in all that we do.
 * Genuine career growth opportunities as we continue to expand!

More about VAPAR

Website: CCTV Pipe Inspection Software Powered with AI - https://vapar.co/

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/vapar

VAPAR was founded by Amanda Siqueira and Michelle Aguilar in 2018. As a Civil Engineer, Amanda had seen enough of the inefficiencies in the pipe condition assessment process, and teamed up with Michelle (a Mechatronic Engineer with Intelligent Systems experience) to build technology to enable pipe asset managers to revolutionise their way of working. Since then, the VAPAR team has grown and now has clients in Australia, the UK and New Zealand and continues to scale.

job_title: Director, Risk Practice Lead, Visa Consulting & Analytics, AuNZSP (Syd / Mel)
job_description:
Company Description


Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.


Job Description


The Role

Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA) drives tangible, impactful and financial results for Visa's clients, including card issuers, acquirers, and merchants. Drawing on our expertise in strategy consulting, data analytics, brand management, marketing, operations, and macroeconomics, VCA solves the most strategic problems for our clients.

The VCA team within Australia provides a comprehensive range of consulting services and solutions to our clients in Australia and New Zealand, that address unique challenges in areas such as strategic growth, profitability, risk management and digital strategy.

We are currently looking for a Director to lead VCA’s Risk Consulting Practice for the AuNZSP region. In this role, the Director will be responsible for the management and growth of the Practice, holding accountabilities that span, business development, leading consulting engagements, and developing new solutions to continuously enhance the Practice’s client offerings.

On the business development side, the Director will work closely with Visa’s Client Advisory team to identify opportunities to assist Visa’s issuing and acquiring clients. This will entail, needs discovery and scoping, proposal development, sales support, and project setup and initiation.

The Director will also be responsible for project execution, typically leading small teams of consultants and cross-functional experts across a range of client engagements simultaneously. This will involve the Director collaborating with the client team and internal colleagues, gathering and managing project inputs, analysing data to form conclusions and recommendations, developing and presenting compelling project reports and working with clients on executing recommendations.

The full range of responsibilities are detailed below:

Responsibilities

On a project-by-project basis:

 * Prepare client project proposals, clarifying objectives, scope, deliverables, approach, dependencies, roles and responsibilities; draw input from clients, local client relationship managers and functional teams
 * Oversee project setup including contracting documentation, stakeholder engagement, interview guides and client data requirements
 * Develop a fact base by undertaking client interviews, collecting and analysing inputs such as client data, process flows, policies, competitive, industry and environmental information
 * Analyse Visa and client data to conduct benchmarking, identify performance gaps and improvement opportunities
 * Collaborate with data science team members to leverage advanced data analytics capabilities
 * Manage execution of one or more project engagements, building client relationships, utilising governance frameworks and mitigating / resolving complex problems that emerge
 * Identify solutions and recommendations that address client objectives and result in performance improvement; leverage relevant VCA methodologies, frameworks and global best practices
 * Design and deliver compelling presentations to illustrate findings, ideas and recommendations

More generally:

 * Identify and surface client opportunities
 * Create, develop and maintain VCA IP, consulting offerings and thought leadership on the fraud landscape
 * Manage overall practice growth and delivery performance


Qualifications


Having already accumulated a variety of experience, you will be familiar with the payments industry and keen to work alongside an experienced team in gaining a deeper understanding. You will be client driven, comfortable managing a project end to end and relishing the opportunity to work closely with clients to influence their future performance.

Specific skills and experience you will bring are:

 * Deep experience in Payments Fraud management and / or consulting
 * Deep experience in card payments
 * Deep experience in managing complex projects
 * An ability to identify new opportunities for client engagements based on their expressed and inferred needs, as well as the ability to translate this into compelling proposals
 * Superior analytical and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigour
 * Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style; able to work effectively in a matrixed organisation
 * Excellent detail orientation in creating client-ready deliverables, ensuring the highest level of quality/rigour in reports and data analysis
 * Excellent presentation skills, including strong oral and written capabilities
 * Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently
 * Experience in and passion for the power of analytics to inform and drive strategy and tactics, and proven ability to generate insights from data
 * Strong commercial acumen, with experience in working on business cases that prove ROI

In addition, you will ideally bring the following:

 * 10+ years of work experience post University
 * Experience in payments or banking industry


Additional Information


Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

* APAC leading audience intelligence SaaS
 * Competitive salary package on offer
 * Flexible & open to locations across Australia (including remote)



Isentia is the Asia-Pacific region's leading media intelligence company; empowering clients to understand their brand and reputation. Our clients are diverse, ranging from globally renowned brands right through to government bodies and not for profit organisations.

Isentia is part of the Access Intelligence group. Access Intelligence a tech innovator, delivering high quality SaaS products that address the fundamental business needs of clients in the marketing and communications industries. We combine AI technologies with human expertise to analyse data and create insights to understand what has impact on an organisation and their key audiences – from customers to stakeholders, politicians to influencers and the media.

As a Senior ML Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing cutting-edge machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex business problems.

You’ll lead the design, development and implementation of machine learning models and services to address business challenges, whilst mentoring & coaching a small team.

Requirements

 * Master's or PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.5 years of experience in machine learning, data science, or related fields, with a proven track record of designing and implementing machine learning solutions in real-world applications.
 * Extensive programming skills in Python
 * Experience with machine learning libraries and frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, NLTK, spacy, scikit-learn, pandas and numpy.
 * Strong understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms, including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, and natural language processing.
 * Preferably experience with AWS services such as EC2, ECS, EKS.
 * Experience with databases such as SQL and Sqlite.
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
 * Up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning research, technologies, and methodologies

* Join a growing machine learning and data science team
 * Sustainability - We are certified carbon neutral and committed to reducing our impact on the environment.
 * Charities – We have long-term partnerships with charities working to address homelessness.


We're REA

REA Group
is not your average digital business. From humble beginnings in a garage in Melbourne’s east in 1995, we have grown into a leading global digital business, specialising in property.

With bold and ambitious goals, we are changing the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help with every step - whether that's finding or financing your next home.

Our people are the key to our success. At the heart of everything we do, is a thriving culture centred around high performance and care. We are purpose driven and collaborative, which drives innovation and our ability to make a real impact. As such, we’re proud to be named in Australia’s “Top 5” Best Workplaces two years in a row, as well as being recognised as a Best Workplace for Women.

Where the team fits in
The Senior ML Engineer sits in the Data Science team within Consumer Experience, which sits within the broader Product & Audience group, headed up by Melina Cruikshank.

The Data Science teams’ mission is to propel REAs strategy through data and data science, driving largest & most engaged audiences, unparalleled data insights, and superior customer value. We combine our extensive behavioural data with property, listings, content and market data (and more) to understand our audience, properties and the market. These rich insights are then used to provide consumers personalised, relevant, contextual and timely marketing communications, content and experiences. They are also used to provide unique and powerful insights to our customers and partners, helping them better understand their audiences, properties, leads, markets and product performance.

To do this, we develop, engineer, manage and maintain a range of machine learning models and processes, from classification models to deep learning algorithms, recommendation engines and more.

The Data Science team work closely with many teams across the business, including several teams in Consumer Product & Experience, Customer Product & Experience, PropTrack and Data Services, among others.

What the role is all about
The Senior Machine Learning Engineer supports the business in the following ways:
 * Design, code, test, and deploy data science product pipelines using AWS SageMaker, Docker, Airflow, Python, BigQuery SQL, and other technologies.
 * Use domain knowledge and exploratory data analysis techniques to engineer features from raw data.
 * Develop appropriate machine learning models to extract insights to help improve property valuations, predict user behaviour, and build personalised consumer experiences using recommendation engines.
 * Productionise new machine learning models and pipelines based on both structured and unstructured data (e.g. image and text).
 * Maintain and enhance existing MLOps capabilities in both the experimentation and productionisation of models, including the creation and maintenance of required cloud infrastructure.
 * Enable and build data and model visualisation tools for analytics and business support.
 * Support the design of data products in consultation with internal stakeholders
 * Lead and deliver projects
 * Ensure that quality and teamwork is being fostered in the Data Science team
 * Actively participate in building REA’s reputation for data science and analytics - internally and externally.
 * Willingness to mentor/knowledge share with junior team members.


Who we’re looking for
Our ideal candidate will have skills in the following areas:
 * Proven relevant commercial experience in ML engineering, data science or similar roles.
 * Tertiary qualifications in ML or data engineering, software development, data science OR equivalent experience.
 * Proficiency in Python, SQL, and/or other relevant software/languages. We’re happy for you to learn the particulars on the job, but you need to be able to code.
 * Proficiency with DevOps tools and techniques, particularly Docker, Git, GCP, AWS and CI/CD.
 * Proficiency with machine learning in a commercial production environment- experience with developing APIs, streaming data (eg Flink, Kafka), and generative AI is a plus.
 * Demonstrated ability to clean, synthesise, transform and manage data of any format and from various sources to provide value to the business.
 * Demonstrated knowledge and application of machine learning, statistical analysis and modelling on both structured and unstructured data (eg image and text).
 * Ability to communicate, collaborate, and contribute effectively across teams and with various business stakeholders.
 * Ability to present data, findings and recommendations to a high standard.
 * Motivation to learn – we are constantly learning together, mentoring each other and striving to do things better.


The REA experience
The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.

We offer:
 * A hybrid and flexible approach to working
 * Flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers
 * Programs to support mental, emotional, financial and physical health & wellbeing
 * Our Because We Care program offers employees volunteering leave, community grants, matched payroll giving and our Community Café donates 100% of revenue to charity.
 * Hack Days so you can bring your big ideas to life
 * Performance recognition programs because hard work should never go unnoticed


Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe teams with diverse ideas and experiences are more creative, more eﬀective and fuel disruptive thinking - be it cultural and ethnic backgrounds, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other identity or lived experience. We know diverse teams are critical to maintaining our success and driving new business opportunities. If you've got the skills, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.

If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application, and preparing to come back to you with an update, why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels?

#LI-HYBRID

Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.


At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.


About the team


The AI Products group exists to collaboratively build products that use AI and ML to reduce toil and deliver the right insight at the right time. Working within the Data & Science team, you will join a diverse, globally distributed team of scientists, engineers, product managers, and analysts who help Xero turn data into beautiful, insightful products.


ML engineers design and build the infrastructure and services that power AI products that serve millions of customers every day. They also work closely with Applied Scientists through the research and development process to create harnesses and interfaces to safely take models from research to production environments. As a Staff ML Engineer, you will lead delivery programs and co-lead research programs that push the boundaries of what's possible with today's technology.




ABOUT THE ROLE

 * Leading the design of our AI research and production infrastructure and services, ensuring that our services scale while preserving flexibility for research teams
 * Owning our strategy for managing the growth rate of technical debt and costs across our stack
 * Making sure we're solving the right problems with the right methods
 * Sharing knowledge with colleagues and lifting the bar for the AI Products team
 * Working with teams across Xero to improve the quality and usability of data
 * Building Xero's profile in market through public facing content and events


ABOUT YOU

 * You have 5+ years of experience delivering ML and AI products at scale
 * You are drawn to solving hard problems and understanding how things work
 * You are comfortable learning new frameworks (distributed processing, ML, etc) and applying them to real problems
 * You are willing to dive into the unknown, and allow new information to change your decisions
 * Constant learning and growth are an important part of who you are
 * You are always willing to learn from others and ask for help


WHAT YOU'LL BRING WITH YOU

 * Strong coding and system design skills in Python or another language used in web scale data and AI applications
 * Strong SQL skills and understanding of distributed processing (data, ML, etc)
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills for communicating technical concepts to technical and business stakeholders
 * Experience developing sensible standards and mentoring early career ML engineers
 * Familiarity with Tensorflow is a nice to have

Why Xero?
Offering very generous paid leave to use however you’d like (plus statutory holidays!), dedicated paid leave to care for your physical and mental wellbeing as well as an Employee Assistance Program to access mental health care for you and your family, health insurance, life insurance, and income protection, wellbeing and sports programmes, employee resource groups, 26 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, an Employee Share Plan, beautiful offices, flexible working, career development, and many other benefits that reflect our human value, you’ll do the best work of your life at Xero.


Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. Our goal is to make sure you feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.


At Xero we embrace diversity and inclusion and value a #challenge mindset. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single competency or experience . If you are excited about this role, but your past experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be just the right person for this role and Xero. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application and throughout the interview process.

About us
CHEP exists at the intersection of creativity, technology, media, and data. Our vision is to Create What's Next – a constant mission to lead the industry in defining the shape of modern communications and advertising. The synchronization of our strategic positioning and our engaging creative, combined with the next generation of engagement planning ensure we deliver ideas that create the cut-through needed to deliver the strongest commercial performance. Today, creativity cannot be left to chance. One brand expression or big TV ad is simply not enough.
CHEP Data as a creative differentiator
Data is pivotal to everything done by CHEP and consequently the Data Science consultancy offering has been, and continues to be, pivotal to CHEP's ongoing success and is a critical enabler of our Connected Creativity philosophy.
Data Science offers the ability to manipulate and interpret a business' most valuable asset to inform business transforming strategies. Add to this the increasingly complex technology environments clients are required to work with (both in their owned environment and the wider media landscape), strategic, analytical, and technological minds are required to help navigate them in new and creative ways.
The Data Science team at CHEP is responsible for everything from Data Engineering and BI, through to predictive analytics and applications of AI. The unique blend of skills are what sets CHEP apart from the pack and makes us a truly unique team in the advertising industry. If you are someone who likes to be a part of innovation, creativity and pride yourself on creating accurate, robust and actionable data solutions, then you will fit right in at CHEP.
Purpose of the Role
As an experienced / mid-tier Data Scientist, you are well versed in advanced statistical analysis, data mining, and data visualisation techniques, to create solutions that enable enhanced decision making and business performance.
The purpose of the Data Scientist is to combine data, computational science, and technology with advertising and marketing knowledge, to drive high-value insights, and use your first-class storytelling skills to powerfully communicate the key insights to our clients and the broader business. As a part of the Planning - Data team, you collaboratively work with Account Service Leads, Tech program Leads, clients and other areas of the business, to understand the business problems and key decisions to be solved through insightful analytics. You will use the data science toolkit to identify trends, patterns and insights from raw data and extract meaning from data, uncover insights and identify opportunities to inform business decision making.
You will play a key role in the establishment of our Advanced Analytics capabilities and contribute to CHEP Networks evolving data science product suite, to ensure we continue to deliver first class capabilities to our clients, and increase profitability for CHEP Network.
The CHEP data team is collaborative, and the successful candidate will work within a close-knit team, where members support each other to deliver first-class data services to our clients. The successful candidate will possess a blend of commercial acumen and technical data skills to be able to support our clients with their advanced analytics needs as a key member of the Data Science team.
Key Responsibilities


 * Collect, gather, analyse, and visualise information to create insights through analysis and modelling, disseminating these findings in clear and concise reports to clients.
 * Work with clients to understand their business needs and propose and lead data science solutions.
 * Lead the acquisition of additional data when required, to resolve specific business issues, enhance analytical capabilities, and inform decisions.
 * Effectively record, manage and store information and data for future reference and reporting.
 * Adhere to coding and knowledge sharing best practice, contributing to a cross skilled collaborative team.
 * Automate information delivery where appropriate to processes and people to increase speed of information and decision making, allowing action to be taken with certainty, and at a lower cost.
 * Build and contribute to a creative, forwards thinking analytics culture to drive best outcomes for clients.
 * Contribute to the growth of CHEP Networks AI capabilities, bringing fresh ideas to the table.

Experience and Capabilities
Essential


 * Proficiency in data science toolsets (SQL, Python etc.) and algorithms (regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modelling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.) to create analytical assets and monitor these for ongoing accuracy.
 * Experience across data environments and tools such as AWS (S3, Redshift etc.), Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery SQL, Big Query ML).
 * Proficient in at least one visualization tool (Tableau, Datarama, Looker etc.) to develop data insights.
 * Sound problem solving skills - ability to analyse and understand complex data problems and determine appropriate solutions.
 * Strong analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy to provide business relevant insights and actionable models.
 * Ability to engage and workshop with diverse clients' stakeholders, account services leads, tech program leads to deliver Data Science and Analytics solutions.
 * Strong consultative skills, with a proven ability to work well with others and communicate effectively and clearly.

Desirable


 * Experience with Airflow
 * Adobe Analytics
 * Google Analytics
 * Experience or deep interest in AI applications and methodology beneficial
 * Experience in Advertising a bonus

Job Specific Capabilities
As a part of this team, you will be expected to have the following capabilities.


 * Strong problem solving, data and analytical skills, numeracy and attention to detail
 * Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines or communicate early when blockers arise
 * Ability to ensure quality of an individual's own work and ensure delivery meets CHEP standards
 * Must be a team player

Please note: All applicants must have the right to work in Australia.

Machine Learning Engineer


AI Architects pay attention!

Ready to take the next step in your career and join the AI revolution at an industry leader within the High-Impact, Healthcare sector - where your exceptional skills will be noticed Every. Single. Day? Sounds interesting, right? Get in touch!

 * Unite, collaborate, and learn from ML experts who live for AI!
 * Grow and establish yourself within an industry, exploding with opportunity
 * Forge your own career pathway with the company employees' first environment!

The Company

Our Client is a homegrown Australian AI company, transforming how healthcare professionals across Australia work and are about to explode onto the global stage! This expansion phase means tech titans (LIKE YOU) have an incredible opportunity to join these professionals, fuel the expansion, and improve millions of lives in the process!

The Opportunity

You’ll join a flexible team of Data Scientists, MLEs, and Developers like you who create, collaborate, and captivate each other to produce the highest quality technology. You will solve real-world issues efficiently and accurately within a deadline.

You will need

 * Experience in the end-to-end process of ML Model development
 * Experience utilizing Deep learning tools such as Pytorch/Tensorflow
 * The ability to work in a Fast and collaborative team environment

The Opportunity will offer you…

Job no: 0061617
Location: Parkville
Role type: Full-time; Fixed-term for 12 months
Department: Operational Performance Group
Salary: UOM 7 – $102,338-$110,780 p.a. plus 17% super

 * Apply various data analysis techniques to uncover new indicators of misconduct
 * Safeguard academic integrity for the university
 * Brilliant benefits and a flexible hybrid work environment!

About the Role
This presents an exciting opportunity for an experienced Data Scientist to support the Academic Integrity Office. In this important role, you will utilise your expertise to identify patterns and anomalies in data to support the detection of student academic misconduct. With a minimum of 3 years' experience, you will apply various statistical and data analysis techniques, source new data, conduct feature engineering and experimentation to uncover new indicators of misconduct and support university investigation capabilities. Additionally, you will collaborate with other members of the data team to transition features into a production environment, ensuring they are accessible for use in downstream Decision Support Tools.

This role offers valuable experience working with senior stakeholders and across multi-disciplinary teams, contributing significantly to safeguarding the academic integrity of the University of Melbourne.

Your responsibilities will include:

 * Analyse new and existing data sources to assess their applicability to address the business issue.
 * Extract and manipulate data from a variety of sources and subsequently cleanse, standardize, scale, bin, categorise, tokenise, stem and transform it into a state suitable for further analysis.
 * Determine whether a given problem can be usefully addressed with analytical techniques and, if so, what further information or data is required to make this possible.
 * Present data findings to stakeholders and make recommendations.
 * Workshop potential indicators with stakeholders and test viability

Who we are looking for
We are seeking an experienced data scientist who possesses creativity and forward-thinking abilities to confidently collaborate with our stakeholders and identify patterns. The ideal candidate should be flexible, self-directed, and an excellent communicator capable of explaining complex data and patterns to non-technical senior stakeholders.

You will also have:

 * 3+years experience in Data Science, preferably in Fraud analytics
 * A sound understanding of statistical and analytical modelling methodologies, techniques, tools and platforms
 * Demonstrated experience in the design, development and implementation of predictive risk models
 * Experience with a range of languages/tools/datastores that could include: R, SQL, Python, Git, Snowflake, AWS, PowerBI.

For further information regarding responsibilities and requirements please refer to the attached PD.

Please note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. This role requires current valid work rights for Australia.

Your new team – Operational Performance Group and University Decision Support (UDS)
The Operational Performance Group delivers functions that facilitate the design, evaluation, and improvement of services across the University, and business partnering services to Chancellery.

The University Decision Support function provides the University with a high-quality data asset, reporting and analytical services to support the corporate function, assist students to successfully obtain an education and to facilitate the effective delivery of University based research. You will be working closely with the Academic Integrity Office, being embedded in Scholarly Services and also UDS across your working week.

What we offer you!
In addition, we offer the opportunity to be part of a vibrant community and enjoy a range of benefits including generous leave provisions, salary packaging, health and well-being services, and discounts on graduate courses. For more information check out our benefits page!

The University of Melbourne
We’re tightly connected with the community, both at home and abroad. We take pride in our people, who all contribute to our mission to benefit society through the transformative impact of education and research. Discover more via our website and stay connected with our stories and people on LinkedIn.

Be yourself
The University of Melbourne values the unique backgrounds, experiences, and contributions that each person brings to our community and welcomes and celebrates diversity. First Nations people, those identifying as LGBTQIA+, parents, carers, people of all ages, abilities, and genders, and people of diverse ethnicity, nationality, and faith are encouraged to apply. Our aim is to create a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live. For more information please visit our Diversity and Inclusion page.

Who are we?

Immerge Recruitment is thrilled to unveil an exceptional opportunity for an experienced Data Scientist to join our esteemed client, a global technology leader with an innovative spirit, on a transformative 12-month contract! Client Overview:

Our client, a pioneer in the tech industry known for fostering innovation, is seeking a skilled Data Scientist to contribute to their analytics initiatives. This 12-month contract offers a unique chance to collaborate with a dynamic team and contribute to cutting-edge projects that impact the global landscape.

Key Responsibilities:

 * SQL Mastery: Utilize your expertise in SQL to analyze extensive datasets.
