Company Description


Sia Partners is a next-generation management consulting firm and pioneer of Consulting 4.0.

We offer a unique blend of AI and design capabilities, augmenting traditional consulting to deliver superior value to our clients. With 2,800 consultants in 20 countries and expertise in more than 30 sectors and services, we optimize client projects worldwide.

Through our Consulting for Good approach, we strive for next-level impact by developing innovative CSR solutions for our clients, making sustainability a lever for profitable transformation.

Our continued success and expansion are primarily due to the quality of our team members. Our consultants work closely with the C-suite at our clients to accelerate and de-risk business growth while improving their customer and employee experience. Our knowledge and fresh thinking help us to create innovative, yet pragmatic, solutions to critical business issues.


Job Description


We are currently recruiting for a Senior Data Engineering Lead - Manager / Senior Manager, Data and AI to join us in our Digital Transformation and Technology service area.

As part of an international and fast-growing community of 250+ data professionals located in our 8 Centers of Excellence (Paris, Montréal, Bruxelles/Amsterdam, New-York, London, Hong Kong, Middle East), you will be an important catalyst in the development and promotion of our offer in Australia. This will involve:

 * Leading delivery projects with our clients on a wide range on topics such as:
   * Data and AI technical architecture strategy and tooling roadmap development, in alignment with corporate and technology strategy
   * Architecture of data analytics, visualisation and AI solutions across technologies including Azure, Snowflake, Oracle and AWS
   * Data and AI evangelist and innovator across the industry and technology landscape to ensure alignment with emerging and leading-edge technology.
   * Cloud technology architecture design, setup, configurations, implementations and integrations with third-party solutions.
   * Machine learning, AI and statistics, including developing predictive models of decision making, supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis.
   * Supporting the adoption and enablement of Data and AI solutions through deep technical expertise and experience realising value from Data and AI implementations.
   * Delivery of data modernisation and migration projects that utilise data transformation technologies.
   * Functional data design, data modelling and data pipeline development (ETL) enhancing the management and value of data across organisations and markets.
 * Technical lead and campaigner in supporting the development of new offers that leverage and expand upon Sia Partners global Data and AI solutions, partnerships and platforms (Heka.ai, SIA GPT)
 * Develop strong vendor relations across the local and national market with key vendor technologies including Azure, Snowflake, Oracle and AWS.
 * Providing technical advisory and support with business development activities and sales.
 * Providing sales opportunities through vendor relations and technology based market activation strategies.

In addition, we are seeking strong technical experience across all or some of the below:

 * SQL skills to support data pipeline and data modelling.
 * Azure, Snowflake, AWS or Oracle data warehousing technologies
 * Data transformation tooling including Azure Data Factory (ADF), Fivetran, Matilion, Oracle Data Integration, AWS Glue, AWS Data Pipeline or other.
 * Azure services including Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks
 * Analytics tooling including Power BI, Tableau, QuickSight or Oracle Analytics Cloud
 * Skills related to SSIS, SSAS and SSRS to support traditional data activities.
 * DevOps and CI/CD to support deployment automation, Azure preferred.
 * Programming skills in Python or similar
 * JIRA / Confluence or similar agile tooling experience

The role ensures projects are delivered beyond expectations and acts as a coach and mentor for consultants.

Your input will assist clients to capitalise on inherent opportunities by identifying and solving their most critical business needs through Data and AI initiatives.

The fresh perspectives you create will help challenge the status quo and introduce new ways of thinking. Working with the team to develop workable, pragmatic solutions and provide a lasting impact by transferring knowledge and building long-term capability for clients.

Bring your ambition and expertise to work with iconic organisations in the resources, energy transport and logistics, health and life sciences, tourism, financial services, government, utilities and not-for-profit sectors.


Qualifications


The successful applicant will have:

 * A tertiary qualification in a relevant field. Advanced studies / Post graduate qualifications are advantageous.
 * Prior experience in professional services (ideally in a Big 4 environment or with another leading consulting firm) is preferred. Data and AI delivery experience is essential.
 * A proven track record of managing the formulation and delivery of end-to-end digital transformation, data, AI, IT advisory and/or enterprise software projects. The ability to lead teams in a project is a critical skill required in our clients projects.
 * Local networks and experience with assisting in business development, proposal and RFP’s.
 * An ability to work independently, work functionally and cross-functionally with large client and vendor teams to deliver quality and complete solutions must be part of your core demonstrable capabilities.
 * Excellent analytical, reasoning, judgement and numerical skills.
 * A positive attitude, creativity, drive and the ability to think resourcefully.
 * Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
 * Effective relationship management skills, able to build networks and influence stakeholders.
 * Advanced skills with the MS Office suite.


Additional Information


Sia Partners is a next-generation consulting firm focused on delivering superior value and tangible results to its clients as they navigate the digital revolution. Our global footprint and expertise across sectors and services allow us to enhance our clients’ businesses worldwide. We guide their projects and initiatives in strategy, business transformation, IT and digital strategy, and Data Science.

We are convinced that AI is the pillar of the new generation. The business expertise of our consultants, combined with our Data Scientists and AI products, allow us to support our customers across the universe of data to meet their business challenges.

Why join the Sia Village?

Excellence | Entrepreneurship | Innovation | Teamwork | Care and Support | Employee Wellbeing

These are the six core values that guide all our actions. As an expression of our values, our Sia Village concept describes our commitment to fostering a sense of community within and among our offices. We believe that knowledge sharing is the key, not only to innovation, but to the growth and development of our people.

You will have the opportunity to provide our team and clients with pioneer mind-set thinking, customized solutions, and you will often have the satisfaction of seeing the impact of your work on their business. We are committed to a healthy work-life integration. We do serve our clients globally and if interested, there are opportunities for international mobility.

Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) are part of Sia Partners’ DNA. Thanks to our expertise in several sectors and our international growth, our teams include a variety of experiences and cultures. We’re confident that promoting DEIB creates an environment in which everyone can reach their full potential.

To learn more about Sia Partners, please visit: https://www.sia-partners.com/en/work-with-us

﻿Location

This position is located at our Perth CBD office. There may be occasions to work from home or at client offices depending on future project needs.

Contact Us

For a confidential discussion please contact Chantelle St James, Recruitment Specialist on 0449 996 822 or via LinkedIn.

Prospective candidates must have the right to work and live in Australia. Candidates currently living in Perth are preferred.

All communications and applications will be handled in strict confidence.



Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Osborne Park, WA, Australia, 6017


Full Time



MinRes is a top 50 ASX mining services company with a strong pipeline of projects that will drive unprecedented growth over the next five years. Our people are the foundation of our success, and we offer attractive salaries and benefits, opportunities for career advancement and world-class workspaces designed for employee wellbeing – to ensure our people get their best life!

About the role

Reporting to the Operational Readiness Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing AI-driven solutions to enhance workplace safety, mitigate risks, and foster a secure environment for our employees.

This position sits within our MRT arm of the business- we transport over 30 million tonnes per annum within our Iron Ore and Lithium operations and are proud to be moving towards a world first in autonomous road trains.

 * Utilize artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms to analyse historical and real-time date related to workplace incidents.
 * Conduct comprehensive risk assessments and identify potential safety hazards using advanced analytics.
 * Develop and implement machine learning models for predictive safety analytics.
 * Utilize AI techniques for anomaly detection, identifying patterns indicative of potential safety issues.
 * Design and implement data pre-processing pipelines to ensure the quality and relevance of input data.
 * Implement systems for real-time monitoring of safety metrics using AI algorithms.
 * Configure alerts and notifications to promptly address and respond to potential safety concerns.
 * Work closely with safety and health teams to understand requirements and challenges.
 * Collaborate on the integration of AI tools into existing safety protocols and procedures.
 * Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analytics, AI and ML.

What you’ll bring to the team

 * Bachelor’s degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
 * Proven experience in developing and deploying AI solutions, particularly in the context of workplace safety.
 * 1-2 years’ experience in Analytical Data.
 * Proficient in programming languages commonly used in AI, such as Python or TensorFlow.
 * Strong understanding of safety regulations and protocols.
 * Knowledge of sensor technologies and IoT devices used in workplace safety.
 * Familiarity with industrial safety standards and practices.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
 * Effective communication and collaboration skills.
 * Ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment.
 * Commitment to safety and environmental stewardship.
 * A passion for data, problem solving and willingness to learn.
 * Positive, “Can Do” mindset, we can achieve anything as a team and often more than you think is possible.

And then there’s the extra benefits

We look after our people because they’re the ones looking after our business. That means a range of additional benefits for choosing MinRes including:

 * Annual cash bonuses
 * Great Employee Share plans – MyShare
 * Employee discounts and offers
 * Physical and mental health programs
 * Salary packaging
 * World class office including on site gym, café and restaurant
 * Free parking
 * Ready for your next challenge? Make a fresh start with MinRes.

Mineral Resources Limited is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer, and we encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply.

job_title: Executive Manager - Analytics & AI, Group Audit and Assurance
job_description:
Executive Manager - Analytics & AI, Group Audit and Assurance

 * You are a technology leader passionate about shaping high-performing teams of Group Audit Analytics to bring our Data and AI strategy to life.
 * We are the Australia's largest Data and Analytics functions driving AI Auditing outcomes.
 * Together we will build tomorrow's AI-safe bank today using the power of data.


Do work that matters

Our Executive Managers are technology leaders that love to build and lead high performing teams working with the business executives to drive enduring value for our customers. They are curious, life-long learners who serve as connectors.

You will be the empowering leader that never shies away from a constructive challenge shifting mindsets and ways of working.

As an Executive Manager, Analytics, you would lead the GA&A Analytics - Centre of Excellence to drive high quality audit analytics outcomes by advancing the use of analytics and data science within GA&A. You will ensure the 30+ audit analytics resources, have the tools, methodology, training, and quality oversight they need to provide high quality insights to senior stakeholders. You would work across the three lines of accountability (3LOA) to improve the overall risk management across the Group.

Your manager would be the General Manager, Strategy & Transformation, and the higher up would be the Chief Operating Officer, GA&A.

We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half their time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available, including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work in the role you're interested in.

See yourself in our team!

In Financial Services, we support the Group's strategy of building tomorrow's bank today for our customers, through a focus on three key priorities of trust, resilience, and capital generation.

Group Audit & Assurance (GA&A) provides independent, objective, and commercial risk focused assurance to the Board Audit Committee (BAC) to assist the Group in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of its stakeholders.

GA&A consists of over 230 professional audit team members, who conduct internal audit and advisory reviews group wide. The team works closely with senior management and teams across the business, including Line 1 and Line 2 risk management, and external auditors. GA&A provides feedback to management on improving their control environment, as well as sharing learnings, including commercial insights and improvement opportunities.

GA&A has an ambitious transformation agenda and aspires to be the global leader of the audit profession. In 2023, GA&A was recognised as an ABA 200 Winner of the Australian Business Award for Business Innovation and Risk Management.

Key Responsibilities:

 * Shape and drive the strategic direction for analytics and data science within the department.
 * Provide thought leadership on emerging opportunities and risks associated with analytics and data science.
 * Partner with the GA&A teams to effectively utilise analytics resources and drive increased use of Analytics and Data Science within the Audit process.
 * Create trust with senior stakeholders across GA&A in the value of analytics and its applicability to the audit process.
 * Support the development of AI enabled digital assets that leverage emerging technologies and industry best practices.
 * Maintain high quality standards for audit analytics output through effective quality assurance and technical review.
 * Support the roll-out of training programs across GA&A to uplift staff capability and hire analytics talent into the Audit teams.
 * Evolve analytics methodology to meet the needs of GA&A.
 * Drive high performance by taking accountability and leading audit team members to achieve GA&A strategic targets and goals.
 * Build and maintain strong relations across the teams within Group Audit and wider stakeholders across the Group.
 * Foster a culture of innovation and agile ways of working.


We are seeking people who have:

 * Extensive experience in a senior analytics or data science role, preferably in an Audit or Risk domain.
 * Demonstrated expert knowledge of analytical codes, tools, and techniques (SQL, Python, R, Tableau).
 * Hands-on experience in developing, implementing, or validating models.
 * Tenacity, persistence and personal resilience during time of change.
 * Demonstrable experience with influencing and driving outcomes at scale with a proactive risk-mindset.
 * Driven by solutions not problems when operating with an Agility mindset.
 * Adept in establishing and growing excellent relationships across the Group Audit and Assurance community and wider stakeholder groups.
 * Experience building and developing high performance teams.
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Tech skills:

We use a broad range of innovative tools, scalable platforms and process frameworks as a technology driven banking organization. We use Teradata, H2O.ai, Hadoop, R, Python, and other specialised tools to carry out our work. We use these tools for traditional BI Analytics, as well as more advanced machine learning models.

We do not expect you to know them all but deep experience or exposure one of the core areas of Audits, risk, including leading largely diverse group of auditing teams and crews in a similar environment will set you up for success in this role.

Working with us:

Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.

Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges and empowered to tackle new opportunities.

If you have the skills and passion to drive the AI Auditing outcomes, then join us on this amazing journey! Apply today!

If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

This role sits at a pivotal cross roads of client and product solutions. In your role as Advanced Analytics Director you will lead the Analytic Solutions, Sydney team in delivering award winning business and marketing data solutions. You will oversee all activities and ensuring alignment with the client vision and objectives. This will involve the management of both your team and client relationships to drive maximum value of your clients media mix and new insights developed for smarter planning and business management.

In your role you will play a key role in improving the analytics tools across the business, staying informed and keeping up to date with the latest industry trends and best practices. You will be highly skilled in research and data analytics with the innate ability to tell a story utilising the data to contextualise the information and promote its relevance in the delivery of key business metrics for our clients.

Objectives:

 * Product: Lead the deployment of the analytics solutions for clients across EM, leveraging Group M’s executional capabilities.
 * Technical: Develop and deliver industry standard analytical models. Guide the team around complex analytical techniques.
 * Client: working alongside the client leads, maintain consistently high levels of delivery and client satisfaction. Support new business pitches with advanced analytics solutions to showcase our capability.
 * Commercial: deliver the product suite needed to hit our commercial targets
 * People: to attract, develop, and retain the best talent in market.


Responsibilities:



When thinking about Product this role responsibility is to:
 * Act as one of the key leads and face of our analytics solution suite across the agency and for clients

 * Showcase how our product suite delivers value for clients.

 * Proven success in delivering efficiencies and growth for our clients using advanced analytics and data science techniques.

 * Construct machine learning principles into our analytic solutions

 * Provide thought leadership, acting as the subject matter expert in the designing and recommending of appropriate analytical approaches and methodology in addressing key issues within the business.

 * Identify areas of product development based on client requirements to evolve our advanced analytics team.

 * Demonstrate improved and advanced analytics operations of the agency through commercial or product success.



When thinking about Technical expertise this role responsibility is to:



 * You will be confident using our available range of tools and software to organise data

 * Build best in class statistical/machine learning models

 * Build data pipeline/infrastructure across analytical platforms as part of product development and project delivery

 * Guide the team to build technically sound analytics solutions

 * Troubleshoot technical and process issues across on-going projects

 * Provide best practice training




When thinking about Clients this role responsibility is to:

 * Be an effective presenter. Have well-developed written and verbal skills.

 * Develop trusted relationships with clients delivering on ROI

 * Develop Snr- Client relationships and extend EM’s breath of contact into Analytics departments within key clients

 * Build strong relationships with clients, become trusted business partner and strategic advisor.

 * Understand client needs and work with colleagues to deliver an analytics approach to maximise client performance.

 * Build clear visibility of all major client initiatives over the next 12 months.

 * Project manage the analytic projects with the team and clients to adhere to scope outputs.



When thinking about Commercials this role responsibility is to:
 * NB - This role is about delivering solutions that drive revenue, but it is not expected to be accountable for the teams P&L and revenue delivery.

 * Be confident in identifying and scoping strategically relevant revenue opportunities for EssenceMediacom and our clients with the Head of, and Chief of department.

 * Provide clear scoping guidance for client opportunities to client leads and Heads of department.

 * Support with the process of pipelining, forecasting and delivery of A&I solutions including Acceleration capabilities enablement in Essence Mediacom.



When thinking about People this role responsibility is to:

 * Manage the Advanced Analytics team based in Sydney, 3-4 specialists.

 * Act as a leader for your team and guide the rest of the agency in the evolution of our analytics solutions for clients.

 * Ensure the team are delivering quality work and respecting deadlines.

 * Own your teams work and develop action plans across your clients’ projects that work to continuously improve performance.

 * Cultivate a learning and coaching culture to develop our talent and play a full role in forwarding their careers.

 * Live and breathe the EM behaviours and be a role model of this behaviour.

 * Contribute to and encourage involvement in initiatives that reflect the EM culture.




Apply now and send your CV via the link!

job_title: Manager - Data and Analytics - Engineering Focus
job_description:
* Not for profit organisation
 * Excellent salary and benefits
 * Flexible working


Our client based in Western Sydney is currently seeking a Data and Analytics Manager - Engineering Focus to join their team on a permanent basis.

Role:

In this crucial position, you will lead and supervise multiple teams of engineers and developers to deliver outcomes focused on value that align with our clients mission.

Responsibilities:

Leadership and Team Management: Supervise the planning, scoping, and execution of D&A projects to ensure timely delivery within defined scope and budget. Implement agile methodologies to manage teams, cultivating an environment of adaptability and agility.

Data Strategy: Identify opportunities for impactful advanced analytics projects that optimize operations.

Data Governance and Data Quality: Work collaboratively with business stakeholders to uphold data governance policies and standards. Ensure the accuracy, integrity, and security of data.

End-to-End Delivery: Lead end-to-end delivery, ensuring adherence to data engineering principles and best practices. Develop and implement changes in the Snowflake/ADF platform using SQL, JavaScript, and Python.

CI/CD and Performance Optimization: Create CI/CD tooling to minimize downtime and avoid adverse impacts on data products. Optimize performance, prioritizing cases where the long-term benefits outweigh the costs.

Management of Enterprise D&A Solutions: Lead the management of enterprise D&A solutions in line with the Data and Analytics Strategy.

Team Leadership and Project Management: Lead and manage D&A data engineering teams and business SMEs, delivering tangible business value to Uniting. Manage the D&A development portfolio, including planning and leadership throughout the development lifecycle.

Organizational Value and Strategy: Enhance organizational value derived from data assets. Contribute to the enterprise data and analytics strategy in collaboration with leadership.

Continuous Improvement and Awareness: Stay informed about industry/technology/methodology trends. Ensure an excellent Staff Experience through effective relationship and quality management.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience (preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field). A master's degree is preferred.

Experience:


 * 8 or more years of experience in the field.
 * Strong written and verbal communication skills.
 * Experience in adapting to new tools or techniques related to data. Thorough understanding of data engineering principles.


Skills:


 * Effective written and oral communication.
 * Empathy and insight into understanding roles, pain points, and opportunities for data products.
 * Proficient programming skills (JavaScript and/or Python).

- Strong SQL skills - ability to review other data engineers code.

 * Strong Azure experience.
 * Experience with Snowflake.
 * Excellent business acumen and interpersonal skills.

- Solid grasp of data governance, data quality, and data management practices. - Proven data literacy.

Even Better:

Robust background in advanced analytics and machine learning.

If the above seems interesting, please submit an application, and we will reach out. For any inquiries, please email rowanmollison@westrecruitment.com.au.

At CommBank we believe in working somewhere that works for you. We have many flexible working options available so talk to us about which arrangements could work best for you.

You are a curious and enthusiastic individual with a true passion for data, analytics and modelling.

We are a committed team responsible for delivering transparency and oversight of credit model performance

Together we will effectively manage credit models within Business Banking and deliver strong outcomes for the Group

Do work that matters:

Risk Management is responsible for developing and deploying the risk frameworks to allow the Group to take conscious exposures to credit, market, operational, compliance and insurance risks within a Board-approved appetite.

See yourself in our team:

You will be accountable for overseeing credit models for CBA's Business Banking (BB) and Institutional Banking & Markets (IB&M). You will use your expertise in statistics and modelling to effectively conduct performance monitoring and fit for purpose validations of credit risk models used in capital and provisioning calculations.

Key responsibilities

 * Model Performance: Analyse the performance of existing IRB and IFRS9 credit risk models. Provide insight on their strengths, limitations and adequacy of usage. Put forward recommendations for improvements and present findings at technical forums. Continually improve the model performance monitoring capabilities by developing monitoring tools, data assets and dashboards.
 * Accountability: Representing the model owner and monitoring team at stakeholder forums throughout the model lifecycle management process (including data, development, validation, monitoring, implementation and governance). Maintain the Group Model Register and other model management activities.
 * Stakeholder Management: Effectively presenting model performance results and their business implications to working groups and technical forums. Proactively address and respond to developer, audit and regulatory queries and/or issues pertaining to models. Maintain sound relationship with development, validation, BU risk teams and other stakeholders.
 * Documentation: Documenting the validation findings, raising appropriate actions for effective model management, to enable stakeholders to understand the strength and limitations of the model and associated impacts.
 * Business Impact: Evaluating model performance challenges, including assessment of the business impact of current performance or new and updated models on risk measures or processes, ensuring the models are fit for ongoing use.


We're interested in hearing from people who have:

 * Strong skills in data analytic, modelling and visualisation using R, Python and SQL with experience in handling large and complex datasets.
 * Experience in model development or model validation.
 * Tertiary qualifications, with above average academic achievements, in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, statistics, econometrics, actuarial science, engineering and data science. A solid foundation mathematical and statistical techniques is essential.
 * Experience with managing stakeholders and resolving disputes.
 * Solid time management and prioritisation skills with ability to work independently and to strict timelines.
 * Experience with the Basel regulatory standards and APRA regulations regarding credit risk.
 * Demonstrated skills in written and verbal communication, including ability to translate complex concepts into simple language for a range of technical and non-technical audiences.


At CBA we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. So, if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't perfectly align with everything in this job advert, we encourage you to still apply.

ABOUT US
CSR Limited is a leading Australian Manufacturing business with a rich history and an exciting future. We are recognised for our innovative approach to developing sustainable and high performing building products and systems for the residential and commercial segments across Australia and New Zealand.
THE OPPORTUNITY
CSR are in the process of an exciting digital revolution and have a new opportunity for a Business Analytics Manager, to join our team and be a part of our critical digital growth.
Reporting into a Head of Applications, this is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analytics Manager who is looking to be part of an organisation that is going through a greenfield transformation with significant investment in their Business Analytics environment.
The overall objective of this role will be to lead and manage CSR's Data and Analytics team. To design the architecture and develop information to drive business intelligence solutions across all areas of CSR, this will enable better business insights that drive significant improvement in business outcomes.

About the role:
The ideal candidate for this role is someone who can see the business outcome required and proactively create a business analytical solution that supports CSR, with the help of their specialist team. It is a role that requires excellent interpersonal skills and a consultative approach and would suit someone that is seeking to utilise their strong business analytics skills, or background as a data scientist, along with leadership ability, to embrace a new challenge.

Some responsibilities include but are not limited to:

 * Lead the data analytics and reporting team, including resource allocation for projects, stakeholder management, recommendations to drive information requirements and solutions, coaching and mentoring team members.
 * Partner and consult with business leaders across CSR in; Finance, Operations, Supply and Marketing, to understand their commercial needs.
 * Manage and oversee business analytics projects and develop strategies for operational improvements and future business initiatives.

About you:

 * Ideally you are a passionate Business Analytics Manager who has solid experience in leading a technical team that supports an enterprise environment.
 * Bachelor's degree in data science, technology, finance, statistics, or a quantitative field highly desired.
 * 5+ years of experience working across Business Analytics.
 * Solid experience in working across a mix of enterprise Business Analytics software (SAP Hanna is highly desirable).
 * Power BI and Microsoft Azure platform experience will be an advantage (SQL database, Data Factory, Synapse Analytics).
 * Excellent communication and presentation skills and a proven ability at interfacing with business analysts and/or end users.
 * Proven experience of leading and mentoring a team of Business Analytics developers
 * A background working as a Data Scientist is highly regarded.

If this sounds like the next step in your career and you want to be part of an organisation that fosters a friendly work environment, whilst providing you with personal and career development – then apply now!
For more information on us, please visit our website at www.csr.com.au
At CSR, we are committed to creating a supportive and engaging environment that recognises and rewards its people, enabling them to grow their career and truly thrive. We are a diverse and inclusive organisation where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.

job_title: Course Coordinator Master of Data Science
job_description:
We are seeking an experienced academic to join this growing higher education institute in Sydney CBD.



Your new company

Located centrally near Sydney CBD, this growing higher education institute offers up to Masters-level qualifications in Data Science. The institute is technology focussed with strong, collaborative relationships with local and global industry. As a rapidly growing institute, they offer excellent opportunities for Academics with the drive and skill to progress their career in a teaching focussed higher educational setting.




Your new role

We are seeking a knowledgeable educational leader to take on the position of course coordinator in Data Science. This role can be offered full time or part-time and is responsible for leadership and oversight over the Data Science programs, including graduate diploma and Master of Data Science. You will be supported by unit coordinators, an experienced academic board, and a passionate team of educators.

To succeed in this role you will:
 * Hold a PhD in any Data Science/ Information Technology discipline

What you need to do now

job_title: Software and Platforms Industry Domain & Decision Scientist
job_description:
WHO WE ARE:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Find out more about us at www.accenture.com.




THE WORK:

This role is influential at its core. You will work with our software and platforms clients to design and implement AI based decision-making frameworks and models to drive insights for decision making to solve business challenges. In addition to key client relationships, you will also be involved in significant engagement across our business, at multiple levels. You will be someone who can identify opportunities for Data and AI and build capability with key teams internally.

To learn more about our AI Practice please visit- Home | Applied Intelligence Networks (accenture.com)




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

 * You will be part of a diverse, vibrant, global Accenture community, continually pushing the boundaries of business capabilities.

 * At Accenture you will work on meaningful and innovative projects, powered by the latest technologies.

 * Accenture will continually invest in your learning and growth.


HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL NEED

 * Qualifications in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Management, Economics or similar areas

 * Demonstrated experience within management consulting and the ability to effectively advise clients on AI specific solutions

 * Demonstrated ability working in data & AI within the software and platforms industry

 * 5+ years of experience in deploying AI solutions in analytics-enabled digital transformations.

 * 5+ years in a people management role

 * Experience in translating business challenges in the software and platforms industry into actionable data & AI solutions

 * Demonstrated experience in working with cloud technologies e.g. AWS, GCP or Azure

 * Experience in designing and implementing data & AI solutions.

 * Direct experience owning or leading a project engagement to achieve successful outcomes

 * Strong interpersonal and communications skills to actively engage with clients

 * Ability to Identify opportunities and deliver programs to enhance business processes using data.

 * Driving the adoption of responsible, ethical, regulatory and sustainable practices in development and deployment of artificial intelligence (AI) systems

 * Ability to drive the adoption and scaling of data, AI and new technologies through business development, and pipeline origination and management.

 * Ability to Influence leadership agenda and support the implementation of platform strategies at an enterprise level.

 * Able to leverage Accenture networks to bring the latest thinking in Data and AI offerings, case studies and market trends.

 * Proactive awareness of emerging technologies, trends, and innovations with data & AI, and its implications in the software and platforms industry

 * 7+ years of experience in the software and platforms industry (or related sectors)

 * Understanding of software and platforms industry specific challenges, regulatory considerations, and trends

 * Due to the nature of work that we perform, candidates need to have valid working rights within Australia (ie. citizenship or Permanent residency)




BONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE

 * MBA or equivalent qualification

 * Demonstrated sustained client relations management experience at a C-suite level or operated at a senior management level in the industry role

 * Experience managing both onshore and offshore teams

 * Progressive expertise in R and/or Python (other scientific languages are advantageous)

 * Understanding of statistical and mathematical knowledge, tools and techniques to derive insights from data.




WHAT WE BELIEVE

At Accenture, we recognise that our people are multi-dimensional, and we create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.




Our unwavering commitment to inclusion and diversity unleashes innovation and creates a culture where everyone feels they have equal opportunity. Our range of progressive policies support flexibility in ‘where’, ‘when’ and ‘how’ our people work to ensure that Accenture is an organisation where you can strive for more, achieve great things and maintain the balance and wellbeing you need.




We encourage applications from all people, and we are committed to removing barriers to the recruitment process and employee lifecycle. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, disability status, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion or sexual orientation and we do not tolerate discrimination. If you require adjustments to the recruitment process or have a preferred communication method, please email exectalent@accenture.com and cite the relevant Job Number, or contact us on +61 2 9005 5000.




To ensure our workplace is inclusive and diverse we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs. job_title: Director of Consulting - Data Platforms & Analytics
job_description:
Join Simple Machines and be part of our mission to help our global client base unlock the full potential of their data through the creation of cutting-edge driven data platforms and technology solutions.



As we continue to expand our team across Australia, New Zealand and the United Kingdom we are seeking a Director - Consulting – Data Platforms & Analytics with extensive experience as a trusted adviser to clients on strategic data projects and working as a leader of consulting and technology teams to see these through to successful delivery.



About You



We are looking for an individual who is passionate about working at the forefront with clients as a trusted advisor to shape their data strategy and drive impact through projects at the intersection of data and technology.



 * You are a natural leader that loves bringing clients and teams along complex yet exciting journeys.
 * You would have learnt your craft and risen to Senior Manager/Director level within one of the top tier consulting firms (Deloitte, Accenture, KPMG, McKinsey, BCG, Bain, EY).
 * You have a proven track record of success leading high value strategic data focussed programmes of work for leading enterprises, governments or technology companies driving transformation initiatives, or high value business focussed use-cases.



Your background



Held a senior role in a consulting firm as a Partner, Director or Senior manager having moved up through the ranks having previously worked in fields that could have included product management, strategy, business analysis, architecture, or technical leadership.



 * Evidence of the ability to understand and influence business strategy and the ability to create transformation strategies and design target state business architecture.
 * Experience across the project life cycle from strategy and advisory, scoping and planning, requirements, design, development, testing, and deployment.
 * Evidence of having successfully delivered and led advisory engagements, driving positive outcomes, and developing opportunities to deliver follow-on work.
 * Evidence of leading successful large-scale, complex technology / data transformation delivery engagements in alignment to a client’s strategic objectives.
 * Evidence of managing teams, including multiple workstreams in complex delivery environments.
 * Experience in leading and supporting sales efforts, as well as shaping deals and engagement commercials.

Requirements

About the role



In this role you will be spearheading how multinational organisations, governments and technology companies solve complex business problems using data.



These projects will involve consulting with clients on:

 * The modernisation and transformation of existing data platforms – shift to the cloud, platform uplift and modernisation
 * Business opportunities with use-cases that can be addressed solved through data combined with technology and our consulting
 * Develop a relationship with key client stakeholders to understand their challenges and business objectives.
 * Relate business problems to the technology teams and communicate how technology provides business solutions.
 * The ability to build and maintain trusted relationships with senior client stakeholders.
 * In this role you will be spearheading how large-multinational organisations solve complex business problems using data.
 * You’ll be partnering with clients to solve complex problems and lead them on a journey from defining a strategy to delivering market-leading solutions that achieve real business results.
 * Partner with senior stakeholders as a thought leader and provide strategic advice to help them maximise the value of their data.
 * Co-create client business objectives and measure performance against these to inform refinements and pivots.
 * Cross-sell and deliver on data projects for key clients, growing revenue and producing case studies to promote the Simple Machines services.



About the team



Our team are a group of like-minded technology consulting experts across Data, Data Engineering, Data Science and Product Management. Our team have honed their skills within some of the leading technology consulting and management consulting firms. As a team we do not accept the status-quo, our role is to challenge and push the boundaries within the world of data engineering.



About Simple Machines



Simple Machines isn’t your typical tech company. Rather, we’re a firm of passionate and talented expert consultants that are as much a community as a company.



When we set out to make a difference nearly 10 years ago, we did so because we weren’t happy with the status quo of technology consultancies. We wanted to build a company we would want to hire ourselves. And we’ve done just that.



At the core of our company is a team of talented individuals, many of whom are at the top of their field. We regularly present at local and international conferences, committing to many of the open-source projects we utilise in our day-to-day engagements and release many other projects back to the broader technology community.



Apply now and let’s see where the connection takes us.

Benefits

Benefits - Working at Simple Machines



We’re looking for someone who’s as passionate as we are about building a world-class company.



Just some of the benefits of working with Simple Machines include:



 * Flexible working: Leave early to pick up the kids? Need to start early some days, later others? No problem.
 * Generous parental leave: Three months fully paid primary carer leave and one month fully paid secondary carer leave, subject to a minimum 12-month tenure.
 * Learning and development: We all love continually learning and have a generous budget for you to upskill, join conferences, get certified and qualified.
 * Lunch is on us. Always! We happily supply lunch at each of our office locations every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday.

SENIOR MANAGER – REPORTING AND ANALYTICS

Apply now
Job no: 3605
Work type: Full time
Location: North Ryde
Categories: Data, Analytics & Insights


Life at Foxtel Group

A career with us means working across one or more of our brands including Foxtel, Kayo Sports, BINGE, Flash, Fox Sports and Foxtel Media. When you join, the Perks at Work are taken care of:

 * You’re part of Fox Flex, our hybrid way of working with time spent at home and on campus
 * Free & discounted products including Foxtel, Foxtel Now, Foxtel Broadband, Kayo Sports and BINGE
 * Special days away from work for Birthday, Cultural & Volunteer Leave
 * Access to our holistic Fox Fit wellbeing program
 * Generous ergonomics allowance for your WFH set up
 * Company-wide meeting-free lunch hours and Friday afternoons

Join Our Team as a Head of Analytics and Reporting - Hubbl

With several exciting projects due to land in 2024 including Hubbl, Foxtel is on the hunt for a Head of Insights and Reporting to enable Foxtel’s Hubbl Business to understand what their customers are doing now and, what they will do in the future.

Working with business users, data engineers, visualistion developers, product owners, marketers and strategy teams, this senior role is responsible for analyzing the vast amount data Foxtel collects across its digital streaming platforms and products like Binge and Kayo. You will be producing insights into what our customers are doing, product revenue opportunities, acquisition and retention, profitability, and ultimately, what we should building into our products to improve experiences and drive growth.

Who we are looking for;

You’ll love data. You’re skilled in data analysis, maths and statistics and you’re comfortable with data engineering and data science concepts. You’re also a gun when it comes to visualizing information, able to tell a “data story” and be passionate about turning data and analysis into insights that give others that “ah-ha!” moment.

You’re commercially orientated. You see data as the fuel for finding opportunities that promote growth and profitability. You’re able to build and present “the pack” that convinces senior leadership teams of the benefits of action and investment.

You’re a proven relationship builder. You’ll relish the opportunity of being the trusted adviser to product owners, senior management, marketers and strategists, helping them understand “what’s possible” through insights developed through application of solid data analysis to vast amounts of data.

Lastly, you will be “hands-on”. This is a role where you will switch between workshopping and design to building presentations, analyzing data, coding, SQL and visualization. You’ll be comfortable directly leading small teams and influencing broader groups of people that will enable the delivery of valuable insights.

A Typical Day...

 * Working directly with business stakeholders and product owners to understand the questions that need to be answered
 * Interpretation of data from data products, analytics and reports that enable business and product teams to understand the impacts of the insights you’ve produced and where/how they should be actioned
 * Building packs, writing memos and developing models that convey findings and prove opportunity.
 * Preparing for regular and ad-hoc meetings where you’ll present insights that “join the dots” between what the data says and its implications on business metrics and KPIs
 * Defining and helping to build data products that enable the business to understand and action data insights
 * Manage work plans, timelines and resources, monitor milestone completion, provide timely reporting of issues, coordinate actions and resolve blockers.
 * Direct leadership of a small team of analysts who are supporting the insight delivery process

Your experience and capability

 * Previous, demonstrable experience in a commercially and/or customer orientated insights and reporting role
 * 5+ years of demonstratable experience applying data analysis techniques to business problems
 * Excellent stakeholder engagement and management including presentation skills and the ability to convey complex concepts in an accessible, engaging, confident manner
 * Prior experience leading small teams
 * Tableau visualization experience a bonus
 * SQL and code-based data analysis experience highly desirable
 * Experience working in Lean-Agile environments with a demonstratable understanding of the underlying concepts
 * Tertiary qualifications in a relevant business discipline well regarded (maths, statistics, computing, business)

A note to recruitment agencies - we have this role covered. There is no need to get in touch, we do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Applications close: 16 Feb 2024 AUS Eastern Daylight Time

company_name: Australian Transaction Reports and Analysis Centre
job_title: EL1 Senior Analytics Engineer, Enterprise Analytics
job_description:
* Locations: Canberra, Sydney, Melbourne
 * Salary: $114,680 to 130,554 p.a. plus 15.4% Super
 * Ongoing and hybrid work arrangement

About the role
As Senior Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for implementing analytics processes and providing technical leadership within a team of highly talented data professionals, to help Australia achieve a financial system free from criminal abuse. Your technical leadership will span multiple disciplines such as software engineering, data engineering, platform engineering as well as working closely with our data scientists and analytics engineers. As the successful candidate, you will possess an understanding of business needs to develop solutions, from prototypes to production products, that solve problems using data, algorithms and custom analysis tools. If you have a strong and diverse, Data Analytics and Software Engineering background and are eager to make a significant impact, we encourage you to apply.

About the team
Our team, Enterprise Analytics (EA), works collaboratively with other teams to develop enterprise scale analytics solutions to ensure structured and unstructured data can be used as actionable regulatory insights and financial intelligence by AUSTRAC and its partners. EA’s remit encompasses building organisational capacity throughout the data pipeline, focusing on the development of analytic tools and models.

What are we looking for
Required


 * Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
 * Experience developing production-grade systems, including work delivering research and development projects to production.
 * Excellent software engineering skills, including 3+ years’ experience delivering production-grade software in mainstream general-purpose languages. We currently use Scala, Python, SQL, and Java, but also encourage applications by people with experience in different main-stream languages.
 * Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
 * Demonstrated ability to apply advanced data science techniques including machine learning, graph analytics, data visualisation and text mining to identify patters and predict outcomes from large datasets.


Desirable

 * Postgraduate degree and/or track record of translating research into production systems.
 * Experience in wrangling complex datasets (SQL, Apache Spark, Palantir Platform) and implementing complex, data science-based algorithms.
 * Experience with distributed computing frameworks (e.g. Apache Spark, Palantir Platform).
 * Exposure to full stack software development.
 * Experience in DevOps.
 * UX design experience.


The key duties of the position include:

 * Take a technical leadership role for projects which solve important business problems by applying software engineering and data science techniques to data.
 * Facilitate the creation of data products and adapt wrangling.
 * Work as part of a team to implement, productise and optimise data science based, algorithms in agile project settings.
 * Identify and apply appropriate design patterns and practices and provide a leading contribution to the design and code review processes.
 * Contribute to architectural and system design blueprints and assist with work planning and estimations.

Please refer to the job specifications to review the position description.

Contact
Carsten Friedrich
02 6183 9551
carsten.friedrich@austrac.gov.au

Further notes:
AUSTRAC is an inclusive employer and we actively encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disabilities, LGBTI+ people, people with diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds and those of mature age. We are committed to creating a working environment that values and uses the contribution and experience of employees from a diversity of backgrounds.

We are committed to providing flexibility in working arrangements to recognise the importance of balancing work commitments with family, caring and other personal commitments of employees outside of work. AUSTRAC currently operates under a hybrid work arrangement.

Job no: 550358
Work type: Casual
Location: Flexible
Categories: Information Technology


Casual Hourly Rate: Casual Academic Rates Apply

Employment Type: Casual

Location: Burwood, Waurn Ponds, Flexible

About the Role:

The School of Information Technology is seeking expressions of interest for casual academic teaching staff for 2024. The School offers undergraduate and postgraduate courses in a number of disciplines including: Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Computing, Computer Science, Cyber Security, Data Analytics, Databases, Games Development, Internet of Things (IoT) IT professional skills, Mathematics, Mobile and Apps, Networking, Software Engineering & Virtual and Augmented Reality, at our Waurn Ponds Geelong, Burwood Melbourne and Cloud campuses.

For further information, the full list of disciplines and to submit your EOI, please go to the Casual Academic Teaching in the School of IT page at School of IT Casual Teaching Expression of Interest.

To be successful, you’ll have:

Essential criteria:

 * Qualifications and experience in AI, machine learning, or data science and mathematics.
 * Successful candidates will be assessed to ensure qualifications meet Standard 3.2.3 of the Higher Education Standards Framework.
 * For teaching Masters’ degree programs, a doctorate degree and professional experience are required.
 * For teaching Bachelor degree programs, an Honours or Masters degree is required. Those with extensive industry experience and tertiary teaching experience are strongly encouraged to apply.
 * Excellent interpersonal skills and a proven ability to establish good working relationships with colleagues.

Desired criteria:

 * An excellent record of scholarly learning and teaching in undergraduate and/or postgraduate programs.
 * Candidates with strong skills in Python and R. Experience with TensorFlow and PyTorch are strongly encouraged to apply.
 * Demonstrated capacity and passion for leadership in teaching.
 * Online/eLearning and project supervision experience.

Your key responsibilities will be to:

 * Enhance student’s skills, knowledge and understanding through the efficient and timely preparation and delivery of learning activities such as lectures, tutorials, demonstrations and/or workshops.
 * Engage students in intellectual inquiry appropriate to the level of the course of study and unit being taught.
 * Provide students with timely access to the information and support needed to complete their work for the unit/s.
 * Mark assessment items.
 * Ensure a supportive and positive learning environment for all students.
 * Be familiar with and follow relevant policies and procedures.
 * Ensure a safe working environment for self and others.
 * Develop and deliver a rigorous and engaging learning experience for students through the delivery of seminars, peer learning activities and supported online learning.
 * Work with program coordinators as applicable on innovative curriculum design and demonstrate a scholarly approach to learning and teaching and incorporating innovations in online and blended delivery as appropriate.
 * Perform associated administrative functions effectively and efficiently including preparation, printing, uploading of results and feedback.
 * Contribute to building relationships within the team and university, including through appropriate and timely communication.
 * Maintaining quality standards in teaching/learning programs.
 * Implementing and modelling high standards of work performance.
 * Developing and maintaining effective relationships with co-teachers, students, and colleagues.

About us:

The flexible learning options we provide our students and our diverse team of professionals and academic experts has enabled us to achieve a 5-star rating by the prestigious university ranking organisation Quacquarelli Symonds. For eight consecutive years, we've achieved the highest level of overall student satisfaction among Victorian universities.

We have a network of campuses, learning centres and research centres across Victoria and corporate offices in Melbourne, China, Indonesia, India and Sri Lanka. Our online Cloud campus provides more than 13,000 students with access to state-of-the-art digital tools and direct access to world-renowned academics.

As a Victorian university with a global impact, Deakin is translating its research into commercial outcomes that will help drive innovation for Australia’s economy.

This role requires the incumbent to apply for and maintain a Working With Children Check (refer to Deakin’s Recruitment Procedure for further details).

Please submit your updated resume, 1 page cover letter and any academic results. Applications for this position close on 29th Feb 2024.

For any queries regarding this EOI, please contact School of Information Technology, sit-cas@deakin.edu.au.




Advertised: 07 Feb 2024 AUS Eastern Daylight Time

job_title: Senior Engineering Manager, Machine Learning Systems
job_description:
Overview:

About AI & ML Platform Team

The AI & ML platform team builds and runs the infrastructure that underpins dozens of Atlassian's AI, Machine Learning & Search capabilities across our wide range of products. Our mission is to democratise AI & Machine Learning for Atlassian’s teams, customers and ecosystem. We do this by creating foundational infrastructure and tools that are user-friendly and reliable - accelerating the development, deployment, measurement, and operation of AI & ML experiences. Our team owns infrastructure such as the platform we use to run advanced generative LLMs & other models, the GPU accelerated model serving platform teams across Atlassian use to deploy their own models, the data access and training infrastructure we are using to develop our next generation of in house AI, the feature stores we use to run personalised recommendations in production, and many other capabilities. We work very closely with our stakeholders - the product & search teams - to help navigate the rapidly evolving space and helping deliver Atlassian Intelligence features to customers.

We are rapidly expanding, and have teams across Australia, India & the US, and sit within the Central AI organisation along side Search & Conversational AI teams.

Responsibilities:

You will work closely with our leadership group of the AI & ML Platform team, technical program managers, stakeholders & architects to influence the direction of the platform and plan the steps to get there - in the rapidly changing AI domain. You will be responsible for building effective teams, empowering them to achieve their goals, and putting those goals into a broader context. Your greatest responsibility will be looking after the individuals reporting to you – coaching and supporting them in their professional development, unlocking their potential, and challenging them to step outside their comfort zone to grow and excel. As a hands-on engineering leader, you will also contribute to the engineering and operational practices and bring in a continuous improvement mindset. As the AI space is evolving quickly - as a team close to the technology there is a great opportunity for thought leadership and helping influence the rest of the company on how they can use our platform best.

Qualifications:

On their first day, we'll expect

 * Significant technical experience with building large-scale backend software / platforms

 * Experience leading, supporting & growing large development teams

 * Familiarity with agile software development methodologies

 * Ability to drive high technical standards, pushing innovation, quality, and operational excellence

 * Driving clarity from requirements and providing direction in ambiguous environments

 * Strong execution focus and proven track record of complex software delivery to production environments



It's great if you have

Experience in AI & ML or Data

Experience in defining a strategic roadmap for products and platforms

Experience with distributed development teams across multiple geographies

Continuous delivery with a strong bias for action



Your background

 * 5+ years of software development management experience, managing team of 5 plus engineers

 * Demonstrated experience partnering with product managers and cross-functional stakeholders to create the course of a platform

 * Knowledge of Agile software development methodologies (e.g., XP, scrum)

 * Demonstrated experience mentoring and growing high performing engineering teams

 * Contributed in the past to the technical strategy of the team

Senior Machine Learning Engineer




 * Harness huge datasets and work on projects to create innovative retail tools
 * Experiment with new ideas, taking a test and learn approach to your work
 * Work collaboratively with other data professionals in an Agile squad setup
   



We strive to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow for our customers and team, bringing the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium together to make data driven decisions. By partnering with Quantium, a world-class data science and advanced analytics business we’re excited about the future as we unlock the power of data to reimagine retail.

Through this partnership, we’ve created a new business called wiq who will harness the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium to reimagine retail by solving the most complex problems using data and analytics. As a team, we leverage Agile ways of working to help our team develop their skills while also making sure our team is focusing on solving the most complex problems for both our customers and team.




What you’ll do




Design, develop, implement, scale and maintain Advanced Analytics solutions using predominantly Google Cloud (GCP) products. This includes for example data models and pipelines, API endpoints, Machine Learning (ML) features and predictive models.
This work is done in multidisciplinary teams in close partnership with Data Scientists, with engineers having the primary responsibility for productionising and scaling solutions.




 * Develop Cloud based ML pipelines to solve a broad range of business problems.
 * Work collaboratively with Data Scientists, ML Engineers & Data Engineers to develop cutting edge retail tools in an agile manner
 * Create, present and seek inputs and feedback on architecture, solution designs and foster alignment and support for solutions
 * Apply relevant testing frameworks to ensure the robustness of solutions
   Communicate analyses, insights, solution designs and showcase working solutions
   
   
 * 


What you’ll bring

We are looking for an experienced Senior ML Engineer, with a problem solving mindset, able to take sometimes nebulous and abstract challenges, break it down into components and develop solution hypotheses.



 * Bachelor or above degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field
 * Solid Python and SQL
 * Practical experience with ML algorithms, techniques and packages alongside experience building Machine Learning pipelines
 * Experience with Google Cloud preferred
   Experience in ML Ops / DevOps preferred
   
   
 * 



What you’ll experience




 * Our Team Members are at the heart of everything we do and we’re always looking for ways to support your career journey and reward great work:
 * Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work.
 * A global business with endless career possibilities around every corner and across every discipline – with valuable exposure to a vast and exciting business network.
 * High impact role supporting our teams who enrich our communities.
 * A range of programs to help you prioritise and manage your wellbeing, including 24/7 access to the Sonder app.
   A progressive and competitive leave policy that gives you more space for what matters to you.
   
   
 * 
   



Endless possibilities with Woolworths Group



We’re a proud part of the Woolworths Group – 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives working together connected by a shared Purpose – ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.’



Here you’ll be supported and empowered to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. Backed by a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and the support to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.




Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group



Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team’s diversity brings to our business, customers, and communities and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best selves, and reach their full potential.



We encourage all candidates to apply; please let us know in your application if we can support you with any adjustments in the hiring process.




You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au . #LI #work180. #hybrid

Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

job_title: Senior Manager, AI and Advanced Analytics
job_description:
At Allianz, we’re proud to be one of the world’s leading insurance and asset management brands, with a workforce as diverse as the world around us.


We care about our customers, which is why we hire the very best people to further our commitment to securing the future of our customers, partners, and the community so we’re ready when they need it most.
We offer our people a workplace where everyone feels like they belong, while promoting a culture of lifelong learning, development, and global mobility. Join us and share your ideas, be inspired, give back and feel proud to be a part an organisation doing meaningful work that matters like tackling climate change, mental health, and well-being.


Let’s care for tomorrow, so we can create a better future together, for everyone.


You'll be responsible for
 * Establish and lead the advanced analytics team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment
 * Develop the AI Framework and roadmap to enable rapid implementation within our business
 * Develop and implement analytics governance models and frameworks to ensure the effective management of data quality, integrity, and ethical use
 * Implement agile delivery processes specifically tailored for advanced analytics, emphasizing adaptability, efficiency, and statistical rigor
 * Mentor and train team members to navigate tight timelines and complex technical requirements, enabling them to deliver accurate and trustworthy results based on available data
 * Drive the identification of viable hypotheses, empower teams for experimentation, and commercialize successful outcomes from advanced analytics, data science, and machine learning initiatives



About you
 * Demonstrated ability to build, lead, coach, and empower teams to unlock individual and collective potential, delivering sustainable value from data-driven insights
 * Proficiency in developing advanced analytics and governance processes, ensuring effective management of data-driven initiatives
 * Proven ability to convene and organize forums, workshops, and presentations for stakeholders, addressing advanced analytics use case prioritization and value generation with impactful communication
 * Proven capability to think analytically and solve complex data science and machine learning problems, contributing to strategic decision-making
 * Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders, establishing strong professional relationships and eliciting key requirements through excellent verbal and written communication skills at all organizational levels



What's on offer
 * Be part of a team that’s open-minded, supportive, and genuinely focused on customer outcomes.
 * A sense of belonging in the workplace, where you are welcomed and encouraged to bring your most authentic self to work.
 * An employer that is committed to supporting your work/life balance and is always open to conversations about flexible & remote working.
 * Access to over 10,000 on-demand learning resources and programs, to support you in taking control of your career development.
 * insurance products. Deals and discounts across a great range of retail, tech, and travel brands, and offers for health and well-being.
 * Initiatives to support your financial wellness through selected discounted Allianz insurance products, superannuation matching, salary sacrificing, novated leasing and our referral bonus scheme.
 * The opportunity to take part in our Employee Share Purchase Program- own a piece of your employer.

About Allianz

At Allianz, we care about everything that makes you, you. We believe in an equitable workplace that celebrates diversity and inclusion, where people of all genders, ages, religions, sexual orientations, abilities, and work statuses are not only welcomed, but valued for the perspectives and talents they bring to work. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone can thrive, grow, and contribute their unique perspectives to our collective success and reach their fullest potential.


Adjustments and support
If you require any support and adjustments to participate equitably in our recruitment process, we encourage you to reach out to careers@allianz.com.au for a confidential conversation.


Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow. www.allianz.com.au/careers

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 34805

Director – Machine Learning/AI Operations Lead

Work on cutting edge Analytics & AI technologies in real world environments
Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best
Salary packaging – to suit your personal and financial circumstances

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced MLops Engineer/Lead with the right blend of technical and business knowledge to drive the adoption and implementation of Generative AI across Deloitte.

What will your typical day look like?

This newly-created role will be focused on the generative AI transformation of our business, and will require deep knowledge of the NLP space, algorithms, proprietary LLMs as well as open source LLMs. The ideal candidate will be hands-on and have experience across the end-to-end MLops cycle, including deploying and scaling models in production.

Specifically you will:
Establish and lead the MLops function, defining strategies and best practices for the deployment, monitoring, and management of machine learning models in production environments.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and operations teams to build scalable and reliable MLops pipelines and workflows (LLMs and broader AI models).
Drive the implementation and optimisation of MLops tools and technologies e.g. Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, DataBricks, Synapse, Snowflake (across Azure, GCP, AWS or NVIDIA platforms).
Architect and design infrastructure and deployment strategies to ensure scalability, availability, and performance of machine learning models in production.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand use cases, industry-specific requirements, and business unit needs, and provide MLops solutions that address their unique challenges.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in MLops, cloud computing, and AI technologies, and assess their potential for improving our capabilities.
Build and mentor a high-performing MLops team, providing guidance, support, and opportunities for growth.
Foster a culture of collaboration, knowledge sharing, and continuous improvement within the MLops team and across the organisation.

You are someone with:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Extensive experience in implementing and managing MLops processes and workflows, preferably in a cloud-based environment
Strong knowledge of machine learning techniques, model deployment, and productionisation best practices.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, as well as ML frameworks and libraries.
Experience with containerisation technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and infrastructure-as-code tools.
Solid understanding of DevOps principles and practices, including CI/CD pipelines, version control, and automated testing.
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex technical issues related to MLops.
Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Proven experience in hiring, mentoring, and developing MLops professionals.
Ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects and priorities.

At Deloitte, we focus our energy on interesting and impactful work. We’re always learning, innovating and setting the standard; making a positive difference to our clients and our society. We put coaching at the heart of what we do, helping our people grow their careers in any direction – whether it be up, moving into something new, or even moving across the world.

We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion. We have a diverse collection of people from different backgrounds, with different experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. What binds us together is a shared commitment to value everyone’s perspective and to cultivate inclusion; so that our work environment is a safe space we can all belong.

We prioritise flexibility and choice. At Deloitte, you get trust on Day 1. We know our people get their best work done when they’re in control of where and how they work, designing their work week around their client, team and personal commitments.

We help you live and work well. To support your personal and professional life, we offer a range of perks and benefits, including retail discounts, wellbeing leave, paid volunteering days, twelve flexible working options, market-leading parental leave and return to work support package.
