At Probe CX, we're powered by passion, driven by curiosity, enriched by a purpose to do it better. We work hard and love a good challenge (or multiple). With clients spanning across the Pacific, Asia and North America, we’re no stranger to thinking big and working with innovative minds to achieve great success. We are dedicated to doing things better than the day before, and our exponential growth is living proof that we have stayed true to this ethos. At Probe, expect to think differently, challenge the norm and find your purpose.

Contribute to shaping the data culture of Australia’s leading Business Process Outsourcing organisation. Support clients across both private and public sectors in unlocking the full potential of digital and AI innovations to extract significant value.

About the Role :

We are working with a range of clients in Government, Retail, Utilities, Finance and Logistics and are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Architect to join our team.

As the architect for the platform that underpins data, reporting and AI solutions, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of Probe's analytical capabilities. Your primary responsibility will involve designing and delivering an end-to-end Data, Reporting and AI Platform that harnesses the strengths of market-leading technologies. This platform will serve as the cornerstone for our modern reporting and AI solutions accessed by many of our clients and contact centres. We are in the early stages of executing our Digital Strategy, so as the Lead Architect in the team, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation and delivery, influencing the strategic direction of our data, reporting and AI initiatives.

In this role you will closely monitor Probe's evolving data, reporting, and AI needs, translating these into architectural designs and decisions. Your expertise will be instrumental in determining how diverse solution components and technologies seamlessly integrate to meet these needs, while prioritising maintainability and adaptability.

This position requires a forward-thinking approach, as you collaborate with a cross-functional team to address current challenges and anticipate future demands. As a key influencer in the digital strategy, you will play an integral part in driving Probe's technological evolution, ensuring our data, reporting, and AI solutions remain agile, resilient, and poised for continuous improvement.

As the Lead Architect you will :
 * Conduct in-depth analysis of business needs and collaborate with stakeholders to define platform objectives.
 * Develop platform architectural designs and patterns aligned to industry standards, regulations and best practices and work with engineers to deliver high-quality solutions that balance long-term goals with short-term needs.
 * Assess and select appropriate technologies and vendors, documenting and socialising significant decisions with key stakeholders.
 * Drive data innovation as you identify, design, and implement new data driven solutions
 * Facilitate effective communication across different teams, translating complex concepts into clear recommendations for engineers, scientists, solution stakeholders, and business leaders.


Key Skills and Attributes Required:
 * Bachelor’s degree in an IT-related field.
 * Minimum 10 years experience in a Data Solution Architect role.
 * Well-developed ability to communicate, engage and influence leadership, a range of stakeholders and cross functional teams.
 * Experience delivering modern Data Lake, Data Warehouse and Data Science platforms
 * Experience delivering solutions that power omni-channel customer experiences across digital and contact center channels.
 * Experience across data architecture, data migration strategies, design, and governance.
 * Hands on experience with analytical technologies being used at scale, including depth in the following areas:
   * Azure and AWS cloud services including AWS S3, Lambda, RedShift, SageMaker and Bedrock. Azure Blob Storage, Data Factory, Synapse, OpenAI.
   * Analytical platforms like Snowflake, Databricks, Jupyter Notebooks, PowerBI.
   * Understanding of Data Modelling techniques including Data Vault 2.0 and Dimensional Data Models.
   * Data governance using tools like Collibra or Alation
 * Australian based role |Melbourne CBD or Sydney


What we can offer you
 * Competitive salary package
 * New members to the team can expect to be onboarded into an environment that has the necessary upfront thinking done (e.g., playbooks, lean frameworks) with the opportunity to further influence and refine, allowing you to hit the ground running and deliver results.
 * Hybrid working model to enhance your work/life balance.
 * Ditch the formal wear and opt for a stylish Probe T-shirt instead.
 * Attend and participate in public forums like digital, technology and CX meetups, and contribute to efforts to raise awareness of the work we do and build up our employee value proposition
 * Access to a trusted mental health and wellbeing app, with unlimited use
 * Acknowledgment and celebration of achievements, both big and small, because we recognize and appreciate your hard work. Celebrate your victories with us!


Ready to shape the future of analytics at Probe? Apply now to be our Lead Architect and contribute to building cutting-edge data, reporting, and AI solutions that drive our technological evolution. Join us in Melbourne CBD or Sydney and play a pivotal role in delivering robust analytical capabilities across numerous clients and contact centers.

job_title: Executive Manager – Analytics & AI, Group Audit and Assurance
job_description:
Executive Manager – Analytics & AI, Group Audit and Assurance

 * You are a technology leader passionate about shaping high-performing teams of Group Audit Analytics to bring our Data and AI strategy to life.
 * We are the Australia’s largest Data and Analytics functions driving AI Auditing outcomes.
 * Together we will build tomorrow's AI-safe bank today using the power of data.



Do work that matters



Our Executive Managers are technology leaders that love to build and lead high performing teams working with the business executives to drive enduring value for our customers. They are curious, life-long learners who serve as connectors.

You will be the empowering leader that never shies away from a constructive challenge shifting mindsets and ways of working.



As an Executive Manager, Analytics, you would lead the GA&A Analytics - Centre of Excellence to drive high quality audit analytics outcomes by advancing the use of analytics and data science within GA&A. You will ensure the 30+ audit analytics resources, have the tools, methodology, training, and quality oversight they need to provide high quality insights to senior stakeholders. You would work across the three lines of accountability (3LOA) to improve the overall risk management across the Group.



Your manager would be the General Manager, Strategy & Transformation, and the higher up would be the Chief Operating Officer, GA&A.



We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half their time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available, including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work in the role you’re interested in.



See yourself in our team!



In Financial Services, we support the Group’s strategy of building tomorrow’s bank today for our customers, through a focus on three key priorities of trust, resilience, and capital generation.



Group Audit & Assurance (GA&A) provides independent, objective, and commercial risk focused assurance to the Board Audit Committee (BAC) to assist the Group in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of its stakeholders.



GA&A consists of over 230 professional audit team members, who conduct internal audit and advisory reviews group wide. The team works closely with senior management and teams across the business, including Line 1 and Line 2 risk management, and external auditors. GA&A provides feedback to management on improving their control environment, as well as sharing learnings, including commercial insights and improvement opportunities.



GA&A has an ambitious transformation agenda and aspires to be the global leader of the audit profession. In 2023, GA&A was recognised as an ABA 200 Winner of the Australian Business Award for Business Innovation and Risk Management.



Key Responsibilities:

 * Shape and drive the strategic direction for analytics and data science within the department.
 * Provide thought leadership on emerging opportunities and risks associated with analytics and data science.
 * Partner with the GA&A teams to effectively utilise analytics resources and drive increased use of Analytics and Data Science within the Audit process.
 * Create trust with senior stakeholders across GA&A in the value of analytics and its applicability to the audit process.
 * Support the development of AI enabled digital assets that leverage emerging technologies and industry best practices.
 * Maintain high quality standards for audit analytics output through effective quality assurance and technical review.
 * Support the roll-out of training programs across GA&A to uplift staff capability and hire analytics talent into the Audit teams.
 * Evolve analytics methodology to meet the needs of GA&A.
 * Drive high performance by taking accountability and leading audit team members to achieve GA&A strategic targets and goals.
 * Build and maintain strong relations across the teams within Group Audit and wider stakeholders across the Group.
 * Foster a culture of innovation and agile ways of working.



We are seeking people who have:

 * Extensive experience in a senior analytics or data science role, preferably in an Audit or Risk domain.
 * Demonstrated expert knowledge of analytical codes, tools, and techniques (SQL, Python, R, Tableau).
 * Hands-on experience in developing, implementing, or validating models.
 * Tenacity, persistence and personal resilience during time of change.
 * Demonstrable experience with influencing and driving outcomes at scale with a proactive risk-mindset.
 * Driven by solutions not problems when operating with an Agility mindset.
 * Adept in establishing and growing excellent relationships across the Group Audit and Assurance community and wider stakeholder groups.
 * Experience building and developing high performance teams.
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills.



Tech skills:



We use a broad range of innovative tools, scalable platforms and process frameworks as a technology driven banking organization. We use Teradata, H2O.ai, Hadoop, R, Python, and other specialised tools to carry out our work. We use these tools for traditional BI Analytics, as well as more advanced machine learning models.



We do not expect you to know them all but deep experience or exposure one of the core areas of Audits, risk, including leading largely diverse group of auditing teams and crews in a similar environment will set you up for success in this role.



Working with us:



Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.



Here, you’ll thrive. You’ll be supported when faced with challenges and empowered to tackle new opportunities.



If you have the skills and passion to drive the AI Auditing outcomes, then join us on this amazing journey! Apply today!



If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.



We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.

Backed by a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and the support to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.




Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group

This is a great opportunity to work with large datasets, on high impact data projects, within our pragmatic, warm, friendly and down-to-earth culture.



Our Team Members are at the heart of everything we do and we’re always looking for ways to support your career journey and reward great work:




 * Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work.
 * A global business with endless career possibilities around every corner and across every discipline – with valuable exposure to a vast and exciting business network.
 * High impact role supporting our teams who enrich our communities.
 * A range of programs to help you prioritise and manage your wellbeing, including 24/7 access to the Sonder app.
   A progressive and competitive leave policy that gives you more space for what matters to you.
   
   
 * 
   

Endless possibilities with Woolworths Group



We’re a proud part of the Woolworths Group – 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives working together connected by a shared Purpose – ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.’



Here you’ll be supported and empowered to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. Backed by a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and the support to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.




Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group



Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team’s diversity brings to our business, customers, and communities and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best selves, and reach their full potential.



We encourage all candidates to apply; please let us know in your application if we can support you with any adjustments in the hiring process.




You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au . #LI #work180 #Hybrid

Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

job_title: Retail Market Systems and Analytics Manager
job_description:
ABOUT US






CleanCo is playing a lead role in Queensland’s renewable energy transformation.



We have set ourselves a goal to own, operate or support 5GW of new renewable energy and 5GW of firming and storage capacity by 2030. To meet these goals, we have developed a pipeline of energy projects that CleanCo will own and operate, supporting jobs and economic growth in regional Queensland.



CleanCo is a team of passionate, purpose driven people, motivated to create a better world now and for the future. We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces inclusion and authenticity. If that resonates with you, we invite you to consider a career with CleanCo.


ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

Reporting to the Director, Retail, the Retail Market Systems, and Analytics Manager will play a key role in enhancing the customer experience for Commercial and Industrial (C&I) customers while leveraging advanced analytics to gain valuable data insights. This newly created position is responsible for managing and optimising retail operational and customer-facing systems, ensuring operational excellence, and the generation of customer insights.




You will ensure the accuracy and currency of market information to provide a single source of truth. This will require, validating and analysing data to identify trends and opportunities to enhance the operational utilisation of data and its use in supporting C&I customers.




You will be pivotal in establishing and operating the Market Data validation process including the development of Market Systems Working Group and Customer Data sets and establishing market systems internal procedures and data flows, whilst ensuring User Access Logs are in place and maintained




This is a 2-year fixed-term contract based in Brisbane within a genuine flexible working environment.


ABOUT YOU

To be successful in this opportunity, you will bring:

 * Proven experience in managing and enhancing business systems for both internal and customer facing requirements.
 * Expertise in data analytics, including proficiency in tools such as SQL, Python, R, PowerBI or similar.
 * Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data findings into actionable recommendations.
 * Knowledge and experience of the energy or utility industry would be highly regarded.
 * Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and collaborate effectively with stakeholders.
 * Ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and draw meaningful conclusions to drive strategic decision-making.
 * Dedication to understanding and meeting the needs of C&I customers, ensuring their experiences are positive and valuable.
 * Proactive approach to exploring new innovative technologies and methodologies to enhance customer interactions and analytics processes.
 * Strong project management and organisational skills to manage multiple projects, prioritise tasks, and meet deadlines effectively.
 * You bring the ability to motivate and inspire teams, fostering a collaborative and results-oriented work environment.
 * Tertiary Bachelor qualifications in Business, IT Systems, Data Science, or related field.
 * You have a passion to be part of something bigger than yourself, that contributes to the delivery of a clean energy future crafted in Queensland.


WHAT WE CAN OFFER

We understand that work is just one important aspect of our employee’s lives. We offer a range of benefits that support balance and create an engaging workplace, by meeting you at your life and career stage. Perks and benefits of joining the CleanCo team include:




 * Genuine flex work options – supported hybrid working model.
 * A progressive and inclusive culture that reflects our unique identity.
 * Opportunities to purchase additional leave.
 * Discounted health insurance, Fitness Passport, and health promotion programs.
 * Opportunities to save via Salary Sacrificing which may increase your take home pay.
 * Wellbeing support via our Employee Assistance Program and Mates in Energy membership.



CleanCo is a proud 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer and commits to responding to every applicant.


For more information about CleanCo please visit www.cleancoqueensland.com.au



Job Segment: Environmental Engineering, Engineering

Job no: 0061276
Location: Parkville
Role type: Part-time (0.1 FTE); Fixed-term until 31 December 2024
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Dentistry and Health Sciences
Department/School: School of Physiotherapy - Melbourne School of Health Sciences
Salary: Level A – $80,258 – $108,906 p.a. plus 17% super

 * Join a dynamic team and be responsible for extraction, verification, cleaning and analysis of real-world health data for the PREDICT-RECOVER-HOME project.
 * Exceptional opportunity to provide your data science expertise to a digital health project with real-world health care outcomes.
 * Salary packaging, subsidised health and wellbeing services, fitness and cultural clubs, Myki discounts, and a 25% discount on graduate courses to our staff and their immediate families!

About the Role
Dr Jennifer Jones seeks a talented data scientist to perform the data extraction and analysis for a grant-funded project PREDICT-RECOVER-HOME: Predicting Discharge Home from Hospital for People with Frailty. The project will use real-word health data to predict discharge home and physical recovery of people with frailty who are admitted to hospital at Austin Health.

Your responsibilities will include:

 * Perform data extraction from the Electronic Medical Record and Clinical Research Data Warehouse at Austin Health and other sources as required for the project.
 * Design and perform data verification and cleaning procedures on data collected for the project.
 * Analyse the data collected and interpret results in collaboration with the research team for the project.

Who We Are Looking For
The ideal candidate will be a proactive data scientist who has experience working with real world health data. The ability to apply rigorous data science approaches to real-world health data in novel ways that lead to insights to the health care management of people in hospital with frailty will be essential for success in this role; as is the ability to communicate with non-technical audiences, and share knowledge, insights and results with researchers from many disciplines in friendly language.

You will also have:

 * An undergraduate or post-graduate degree in data science or related discipline.
 * Ability to foster relationships in an interdisciplinary research setting, resulting in successful collaborative research outcomes.
 * High level organisational, communication and time-management skills and demonstrated ability to proactively manage and respond to changing priorities and deadlines.

For further information regarding responsibilities and requirements, please refer to the attached PD.

This role requires that the successful candidate must undergo and maintain an up-to-date Working with Children Check. This is essential to guarantee a secure environment for all individuals at the University. In the case the selected candidate doesn't have a valid Working with Children Check, they will be able to apply for the WWCC as part of the initial onboarding procedures.

Please note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. This role requires current valid work rights for Australia.

Your New Team – School of Health Sciences

The Melbourne School of Heath Sciences is a School within the Faculty of Medicine, Dentistry and Health Sciences. It is an inter-professional learning organisation at the forefront of leadership in health sciences education, clinical research, scholarship, professional practice, workforce training and engagement that contributes to local, national and global efforts to improve health and wellbeing.


What We Offer You!
In addition, we offer the opportunity to be part of a vibrant community and enjoy a range of benefits, including generous leave provisions, salary packaging, health and well-being services and discounts on graduate courses. For more information, check out our benefits page!

About the University of Melbourne
We’re tightly connected with the community, both at home and abroad. We take pride in our people, who all contribute to our mission to benefit society through the transformative impact of education and research. Discover more via our website and stay connected with our stories and people on LinkedIn.

Be Yourself
The University of Melbourne values the unique backgrounds, experiences and contributions that each person brings to our community and welcomes and celebrates diversity. First Nations people, those identifying as LGBTQIA+, parents, carers, people of all ages, abilities and genders, and people of diverse ethnicity, nationality and faith are encouraged to apply. Our aim is to create a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live. For more information please visit our Diversity and Inclusion page.

We are dedicated to ensuring barrier free and inclusive practices to recruit the most talented candidates. If you require reasonable adjustments, please contact Kim Groizard at hr-careers@unimelb.edu.au, with an email containing your name and contact details for a confidential discussion. Please ensure your email is titled "Reasonable Adjustments Request".

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants
We aspire to be the University of choice for Indigenous Australians, with unprecedented investment to attract, nurture and retain Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students and staff. Tangible support through a range of programs and initiatives will ensure that you personally succeed and flourish while at the University of Melbourne.

For further information, including our 2023-2027 Indigenous strategy please visit -https://about.unimelb.edu.au/reconciliation/murmuk-djerring

Join Us!
If you feel this role is right for you, please apply with the following documents:

 * Resume
 * Cover Letter outlining your interest and experience
 * The responses against the below selection criteria only;

 * A track record of applying data science methods to complex real world problems in health care to gain novel and useful insights.
 * Ability to foster relationships in an interdisciplinary research setting, resulting in successful collaborative research outcomes.
 * High level organisational, communication and time-management skills and demonstrated ability to proactively manage and respond to changing priorities and deadlines.

^For information to help you with compiling short statements to answer the selection criteria and competencies, please go to http://about.unimelb.edu.au/careers/selection-criteria

If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please feel free to contact Nick Peterson via email at hr-careers@unimelb.edu.au, ensuring that you include the Position Number and the Job Title as the subject. Please do not share your application to this email address.

If you have any particular questions regarding the job please follow the details listed on the .

job_title: Senior Analytics Engineer - NV1 (min.) - ADL, MEL, SYD, CBR
job_description:
* Join VSG as an NV1 cleared Analytics Engineer and support the development of Defence's advanced analytics platform using modern automation, DevSecOps and cloud practices!
 * Flexible working arrangements- permanent, casual or subcontracting – whatever works best for you.
 * Opportunities available in SA, NSW, VIC, and ACT
 * Ability to work on projects of national significance, delivering cutting edge capabilities to Defence and the National Intelligence Community

Vertical Scope Group (VSG) are continuing to grow and have been invited by our Defence customers to create a high performing team consisting of NV1 cleared Senior Analytics Engineers!

We seek Expert Trusted and Reputable, high calibre and high performing Data Professionals with various levels of knowledge and experience from SFIA 1-7 and Defence Support Services (DSS) Levels 1-5 (Associate, Practitioner, Advanced Practitioner, Expert, Pre-eminent Advisor) to join us in delivering ICT and Cyber capabilities to our Defence and National Security customers.

About You

 * Minimum NV1 security clearance
 * Experience in building mission focused open source products, using Python, Go, Java, and/or C#., and integrating with custom-off-the-shelf products for data analytics;
 * Demonstrated experience in wrangling complex datasets (SQL, Apache Spark) and implementing complex, data science based algorithms.
 * Ability to participate in trouble shooting application performance issues as required, assisting development teams by identifying root causes or bottlenecks.
 * Previous experience in building robust large-scale, real-time distributed big data systems for AI infrastructure with a focus on automation, standardisation and security.
 * Ability to design and develop automated tools and processes to run big data platforms and products on any cloud, including AWS/Azure/GCP, on-prem or at the edge.

About the Role

Your Key Duties will include:

 * Work with stakeholders to elicit requirements, create software architectures, plan and contribute to software delivery and deliver outcomes, including technical and research whitepapers, employing professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations, to meet data security, privacy and protection in regulated environments.
 * Build mission focused open source products, using Python, Go, Java, and/or C#., and integrate with custom-off-the-shelf products for data analytics.
 * Wrangling complex datasets (SQL, Apache Spark) and implementing complex, data science based algorithms.
 * Productionising and optimising (performance tuning) non-trivial distributed databases, algorithms and workloads.
 * Collaborate with engineers, data scientists and UX designers to integrate algorithm implementations with data pipelines and production systems.
 * Build robust large-scale, real-time distributed big data systems for AI infrastructure with a focus on automation, standardisation and security.
 * Design and develop automated tools and processes to run big data platforms and products on any cloud, including AWS/Azure/GCP, on-prem or at the edge.
 * Participate in trouble shooting application performance issues as required, assisting development teams by identifying root causes or bottlenecks.
 * Contribute to the communication to clients, colleagues, leadership and diverse stakeholders throughout the platform and product development life cycle

About Us

Why work for Vertical Scope Group?

Vertical Scope Group are an award winning, security cleared, ICT and cyber specialist with over a decade’s worth of experience providing end-to-end consulting, professional services and recruitment services nationally to Australian Government and industry.

We are searching for exceptional consultants to join us in providing capability to multiple government panels and global supply chains including the ICT Provider Arrangement (ICTPA), NSW TAS SCN0012 – Talent Acquisition Scheme, Defence, Science and Technology Group (DSTG), BuyICT, People Panel (all categories, all locations, APS1- SES Band3, and Board Placements!)

We are proudly 100% Australian owned and run, possess a Defence Industry Security Program (DISP) Level 3 membership, and have won multiple peak body awards including the Recruitment, Consulting and Staffing Association (RCSA)’s 2021 ‘Excellence in Social Purpose’, RCSA’s 2022 ‘Excellence in Client Services’, and the 2022 Prime Minister’s National Veteran Employment Award for ‘Excellence in Supporting Veteran and/or Partner Employment’ for VSG’s WorkPath Australia Training and Employment Program.

We invite you to contact us for a confidential discussion around your career and to learn how we can work together.

We offer our permanent consultants a list of perks that range from:

· Birthday day off

· Additional Superannuation Contribution

· Annual Company Conference

· Paid for attendance at award and industry events

· Generous Defence Leave

· Part-time, remote, flexible work options (when available)

· Attractive salaries

· Fortnightly payments

· Diverse programs to work on

· Professional upskilling with RTO partners including budget for commercial qualifications

We believe people are our greatest asset, and we will work with and support you throughout your career.

If you are security cleared and would like to discuss other security cleared opportunities available to you, please also apply and a dedicated consultant will contact you to advise.

If you want to join a trusted, reputable, expert consulting firm, and work on exciting defence and national security programs, apply here!

Vertical Scope Group encourage people from different backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, veterans, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and people with disabilities.

Apply now by submitting your CV and or cover letter and a dedicated recruitment consultant will be in touch.

Know someone who is suitable for this role? VSG have a $1,000 referral program! Head over to our website for further details: www.verticalscope.com.au/refer-a-candidate Referrals warmly welcomed and rewarded!

*Please note, we will be on leave and will attend to your application from the 8th of January, 2024

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Contract
Contract length: 12 months

Schedule:

 * 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

 * Do you have a minimum NV1 security clearance?

Work Location: In person

Position Description SA Water

Delivering trusted water services for a sustainable and healthy South Australia




Position Title


Lead Reporting and Performance Analytics



Business Group


Sustainable Infrastructure




Manager Title




Manager Infrastructure Knowledge



Business Unit


Infrastructure Knowledge


Direct Report’s Title(s)





What is the unique purpose of the role?




Design and Develop a suite of reporting and analytical insights within Microsoft Power BI that enable Sustainable Infrastructure to understand and manage various performance and intelligence aspects in the delivery of a large Capital Infrastructure Program of work.





What does the role do?




Key Accountabilities


Accountability Details



Performance Reporting


 * Develop strong working relationships with key partners across SA Water to consolidate multiple sources of data across all service channels.
 * Work collaboratively across the business to capture and interrogate this data and insights in a timely manner.
 * Provide monthly performance reports in Microsoft Power BI with a high degree of accuracy in a timely manner.
 * Implement and develop technology to effectively manage data and insights.
 * Primary contact for provision of ad-hoc data and performance requests to internal and external stakeholders.
   
   




Provide a technical performance function




 * Provision of asset performance data in accordance with timeframes established by corporate processes.
 * Ensure integrity and accuracy of performance and compliance reporting
 * Deliver all data and information related initiatives in a way that aligns to and supports Enterprise data standards
   
   


Effective and efficient performance data management service


 * Coordinate the development of a performance data management framework and associated operational systems that allows for effective and efficient capture and analysis and insights generation, for diverse business functions (e.g. corporate reporting, statutory reporting, operational performance and optimisation, asset investment planning).
 * Participate and contribute to forums, initiatives and projects designed to ensure an Enterprise approach to the management and governance of the SA Water data assets.
 * Drive development of tools, processes and procedures that drive standardisation and improved efficiencies associated with performance monitoring, process analysis and troubleshooting across Operations.
 * Support Operations engagement with key business stakeholders to create business value from improved data management.
 * Ensure effective systems and mechanisms are in place to enable timely reporting of compliance performance information
 * Work collaboratively across the business to capture and interrogate service delivery data in a timely manner.
 * Take ownership for bringing and reporting into the team, working closely with the key stakeholders to ensure that enhancements to the reporting systems enable the team to produce reporting at tactical and strategic levels


Knowledge, skills and experience the role requires




Foundation Knowledge, Skills, Experience and Qualifications


Essential or Desirable



Relevant tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, Data Science or similar discipline


Essential



Solid interpersonal skills and an ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders


Essential



Advanced data analytics capability and familiarity of data analytics tools and techniques


Essential



Experience in handling large volumes of data and providing analysis of the data to inform effective business decisions


Essential



Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing and to work autonomously and as part of a team


Essential



Proven problem solving and analytical skills and abilities


Essential



High degree of computer literacy




Essential







Who you work with

 * Sustable Infrastructure Managers
 * Joint Venture and Framework partners
 * Sustainable Infrastructure Staff
 * Corporate Technology, Data and Analytics teams



Special conditions

 * Flexible hours and some after hours as required, some intra and interstate travel.
 * Depending on the role you will be required to undergo initial and/or subsequent clearance checks to ensure your ongoing suitability for the role. These may include a criminal police check, traffic check, Working with Children and/or Working with Vulnerable People.
   
   



The Position Description outlines what the requirements of the role are. The behaviours you demonstrate are equally as important, and form part of the inherent requirements of the role.




Safe Innovative Trustworthy Courageous Agile Collaborative

OFFICIAL

THE COMPANY:

Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software, and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality, and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector, and mobility applications.

Our technologies are shaping the production and people-related ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous — ensuring a scalable, sustainable future.

Hexagon’s Mining division solves surface and underground mine challenges with proven technologies for planning, operations, and safety.

Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 24,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 5.5bn USD. Learn more at hexagon.com and follow us @HexagonAB.


PURPOSE OF POSITION:

Hexagon’s complex analytics solutions are deployed into customer environments to ensure they can gain valuable insights into their operations when using Hexagon’s mining solutions. The purpose of the –Analytics Product Manager position is to define and execute the strategy and roadmap for our data and analytics solutions related to the operational and safety portfolios.

You will work closely with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams, including engineering, data science, operations, and product and business teams, to deliver high-value data-driven products that provide actionable insights and drive business outcomes.




MAJOR AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:

 * Define and articulate the vision for data and analytics solutions, ensuring alignment with the company's strategic goals
 * Collaborate with internal and external customers to identify and prioritize data needs and translate customer problems into business solutions
 * Extract, prioritize, and document product requirements
 * Develop and maintain a product roadmap for analytics solutions, balancing short-term priorities with long-term strategic initiatives
 * Work closely guiding Product Owners to ensure timely and high-quality delivery of features, managing the entire lifecycle from conception to launch
 * Serve as a subject matter expert on the domain data allowing the developers and Product Owner to consult you for guidance while building solutions
 * Drive solution adoption and usage, working with customer success and marketing to create compelling messaging and materials.
   * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment between solution projects, technical capabilities, and business objectives.


KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE - ESSENTIAL:

 * Bachelor's degree in STEM (i.e. Computer Science, Data Science or Engineering).
 * 7+ years of professional experience (minimum 1 year of Product Management)
 * Broad understanding of analytics tools across the data pipeline from ingestion to presentation
 * Mining experience, ideally with fleet management and/or mine safety systems
 * Strong understanding of product economics (i.e. NPV, IRR, payback periods, etc.)
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills including preparation and presentations of business plans for executive level.
 * Experience with modern business data storage, management and visualization tools and systems
 * Ability to work independently as well as in a team, in both remote (WFH) and office environments
 * Effective time management, including the ability to balance work/life while working with international teams which sometimes requires non-typical working hours


KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE - DESIRED:

 * Certification in Agile (SaFe, Scrum, Product Owner etc)
 * Certification in Project Management
 * Experience managing direct reports
 * Experience across the mining value chain including mine planning, load & haul and processing


TRAVEL:

 * Up to 25% domestic and/or international travel.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

 * English fluent. Other beneficial languages include Spanish, Portugese, and Bahasa
 * Salary commensurate with experience and work location.








Hexagon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We prohibit discrimination against any job applicant based on protected characteristics.

Purpose Of Position

This organisation's complex analytics solutions are deployed into customer environments to ensure they can gain valuable insights into their operations when using this organisation's mining solutions ...

At Probe CX, we're powered by passion, driven by curiosity, enriched by a purpose to do it better. We work hard and love a good challenge (or multiple). With clients spanning across the Pacific, Asia and North America, we’re no stranger to thinking big and working with innovative minds to achieve great success. We are dedicated to doing things better than the day before, and our exponential growth is living proof that we have stayed true to this ethos. At Probe, expect to think differently, challenge the norm and find your purpose.

Contribute to shaping the data culture of Australia’s leading Business Process Outsourcing organisation. Support clients across both private and public sectors in unlocking the full potential of digital and AI innovations to deliver significant value.

About the Role :
We are working with a range of clients in Government, Retail, Utilities, Finance and Logistics and are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Principal Engineer to join our team.

As the Data, Reporting, and AI Principal Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in driving the development and implementation of cutting-edge data, reporting, and artificial intelligence (AI) solutions within our organization. This multifaceted role requires a seasoned professional with a strong background in data engineering, reporting and AI technologies, coupled with excellent leadership and communication skills.

We are in the early stages of executing our Digital Strategy, so as the Principal Engineer in the team, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation and delivery, influencing the strategic direction of our data, reporting and AI initiatives.


As the Principal Engineer you will :
 * Design, implement, and optimise robust data pipelines for efficient data extraction, transformation and processing in both batch and real time.
 * Deliver high-quality analytical solutions that balance long-term goals with short-term needs.
 * Lead the implementation of advanced reporting and visualisation solutions, leveraging cutting-edge reporting data models and technologies.
 * Work with Data Scientists to deliver AI and machine learning solutions that produce predictive, prescriptive and generative insights driving innovation in data-driven decision-making.
 * Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies, tools, and frameworks to enhance the organisation's data, reporting and AI capabilities.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineers, architects, data scientists, and business stakeholders, to understand requirements and deliver end-to-end solutions.
 * Provide strategic direction, leadership and mentoring to a cross-functional team of engineers.


Key Skills and Attributes Required:
 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
 * Minimum 10 years experience in a senior engineering role leading the build of data, reporting and AI solutions.
 * Demonstrable experience building and using modern Data Lake, Data Warehouse and Data Science platforms
 * Experience delivering solutions that power omni-channel customer experiences across digital and contact center channels.
 * Hands on experience with analytical technologies being used at scale, including depth in the following areas:
   * Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
   * Azure and AWS cloud services including AWS S3, Lambda, RedShift, SageMaker and Bedrock. Azure Blob Storage, Data Factory, Synapse, OpenAI.
   * Analytical platforms like Snowflake, Databricks, Jupyter Notebooks, PowerBI.
   * In-depth knowledge of data processing technologies including Spark and Kafka
   * Understanding of Data Modelling techniques including Data Vault 2.0 and Dimensional Data Models.
   * Data governance using tools like Collibra or Alation
   * Use of Okta, OAuth and Active Directory identity and access management
   * Experience with DevOps using tools like Git, Ansible, Terraform, CloudFormation
   * Containerisation and orchestration using Docker and Kubernetes
 * Australian based role |Melbourne CBD or Sydney


What we can offer you
 * Competitive salary package
 * New members to the team can expect to be onboarded into an environment that has the necessary upfront thinking done (e.g., playbooks, lean frameworks) with the opportunity to further influence and refine, allowing you to hit the ground running and deliver results.
 * Hybrid working model to enhance your work/life balance.
 * Ditch the formal wear and opt for a stylish Probe T-shirt instead.
 * Attend and participate in public forums like digital, technology and CX meetups, and contribute to efforts to raise awareness of the work we do and build up our employee value proposition
 * Access to a trusted mental health and wellbeing app, with unlimited use
 * Acknowledgment and celebration of achievements, both big and small, because we recognize and appreciate your hard work. Celebrate your victories with us!


Ready to lead innovation in data, reporting and AI? Join us on this exciting journey! Apply now to be part of a dynamic team driving the digital transformation and delivering exceptional customer experiences.

What You'll Do

Teradata’s comprehensive suite of AI/ML technologies and capabilities, externally branded as ClearScape Analytics, enable the largest and most analytically sophisticated organizations in the world operationalize analytics at-scale on the Vantage platform.

The AI Industry Specialist (AIS) is an experienced and expert seller comfortable working across analytics and line of business buying centers to drive continued growth from target customers and prospects. Comfortable with engaging with senior stakeholders they identify, co-lead and co-manage sales motions for opportunities within the finance industry working with the account executives and go-to-market teams. They have quota ownership for expansions and sales opportunities to line of business and analytics buying centers at our top targets.

Key Responsibilities include:
Achieving expansion targets - in coordination with Account Executives, Customer Success Managers, and Industry Strategists, you will build and manage an expansion opportunity pipeline for ClearScape Analytics with an industry focus, sufficient to achieve current and future targets.

Account planning & strategy – you will coordinate and execute the sales strategy for your focus industry; from top-down awareness, contacting and engaging analytics and business influencers, through to use cases and associated analytics value propositions.

Relationship building – developing credibility and establishing relationships based on analytics knowledge, application to real world scenarios, and focusing on generating value for the customer, you will engage personas at appropriate levels – influencers, decision makers and economic buyers.

Customer consideration & influence – lead discovery & scoping activities that highlight ClearScape value differentiators and lead to strong business case development.

Sales Opportunity Management – demonstrate strong control of all sales motions including opportunity stage progression from awareness, consideration to close. Managing opportunities using indicators including MEDDPICC scores, sales stages and aging, as appropriate.

Internal Evangelism – Educate the wider Teradata Go-To-Market population on customer, industry and market trends, successes and key learnings.

Contribute to Industry Strategy – aligning to industry analytics maturity and common themes that can be leveraged to define an engagement strategy for an account.

Teradata Point of View & Roadmap – Stay current and influence Teradata AI strategy, roadmap and differentiation.

Who You'll Work With

Working closely with data scientists, industry strategists and partners the AI Industry Specialist will accelerate the ability to expand and acquire new customers, contribute to industry strategy and play a key role in evolving the capabilities of the GTM organization.

Account Team : Co-lead with the Account Executive to understand and develop account goals, strategy, objectives, & tactics to target the AI &/or Line of Business Buying Centers.

Industry Strategy : Works with Industry Strategist to align on key trends, partners, our POV, sample use-case curation and messaging.

Data Science & Sales Tech : Works with Pre-Sales Data Scientists, Architects and Solution Engineers to understand” as is” and “to be” analytics strategy and landscape.

Client Services & Partner Sales : Works with Consulting and Partners to deploy post PoC / PoVs and create supporting proposals.

Customer Success : Works with Customer Success Managers to understand customer usage patterns (via telemetry) and key user communities, drive customer education & adoption of features, and execute the overall account plan.

What Makes You a Qualified Candidate

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in business or analytics related field.

8-12 years of experience selling, consulting and/or leveraging software & services specifically in the AI/ML and data analytics space.

Demonstrated success in developing and managing complex enterprise software sales and/or large account relationships in the finance industry.

Proven ability to interact effectively with ‘C’ and VP level executives.

What You'll Bring

Is driven, innovative, a self-starter and strategic thinker with strong executive presence.

Can lead, advise, and advocate for customers and is able to build trusted relationships with customers.

Possesses account management discipline across all sales stages.

Has previous experience selling statistical, machine learning, text, path, AI, etc. AI &/or GenAI solutions.

Has awareness and comprehension of the latest AI/ML & GenAI analytics techniques and how they apply to business decisions.

Possesses excellent presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills

Thrives in teamwork environment, is collaborative and recognizes the value of different perspectives.

At GHD, we don’t just believe in the power of commitment, we live and breathe it every day

That’s why we pledge to support and empower all of our people to make a positive impact when working with the right technology and training as you bring ideas and projects to life.

Together with your colleagues, clients and partners, you'll make an impact that is felt by all. See where your commitment could take you.




Who are we looking for?

We’re searching for a Solutions Architect - Enterprise Data & Analytics to Develop, enhance, and maintain our Data & Analytics roadmap to deliver optimal value for GHD, leveraging appropriate technologies, that incorporates the Enterprise and IS Strategy, enabling a data driven enterprise.




In this dynamic role you will:

job_title: Senior Business Development Manager - Data, Data Platforms, Analytics
job_description:
Simple Machines is a boutique technology firm specialising in engineering data to life for leading global brands, governments and technology companies. With operations spread across Sydney, Christchurch, and London, we are a market leading firm at the cutting edge of data, engineering and AI.



As we scale our business across ANZ, we are looking for a proven sales professional who can grow our client portfolio with quality clients looking to unlock the full potential of their data via cloud transformation, decisioning, ML and AI and product engineering.



About the role



As the Client Director, you'll be at the forefront of our growth strategy. Your mission is to navigate the complex landscape of enterprise clients across Australia and New Zealand, positioning our professional services and enterprise data solutions as indispensable assets. You'll craft and execute new business development plans, build strong relationships, and drive new sales initiatives that align with organisational objectives.



What you’ll do

 * Drive new-logos in the region.
 * Market penetration and strategy.
 * Client engagement and relationship building.
 * Solution selling and presentations.
 * Revenue growth and quota achievement.
 * Cross-functional collaboration.



About the team



Our team are a group of like-minded technology consulting experts across Data, Data Engineering, Data Science and Product Management. Our team have honed their skills within some of the leading technology consulting and management consulting firms. As a team we do not accept the status-quo, our role is to challenge and push the boundaries within the world of data engineering.

Requirements

About You



We are looking for an individual who is passionate about working at the forefront with clients as a trusted advisor to shape their data engineering and uncover opportunities for their business and Simple Machines.



 * Proven Track Record: Demonstrated success in over-achieving targets in selling professional services and enterprise data solutions to enterprise clients, with a strong portfolio of closed deals and revenue growth.
 * New Business: A true hunter with the ability to go-to-market and build and convert a pipe of leading enterprises, scale ups and government organisations.
 * Industry Knowledge: In-depth understanding of the enterprise data solutions landscape and custom software engineering, along with the ability to navigate complex sales cycles and procurement processes.
 * Strategic Thinking: Ability to devise and execute strategic business development plans, aligning market trends with organisational goals to drive growth.
 * Communication and Negotiation Skills: Exceptional communication, negotiation, and presentation skills, enabling effective engagement with diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.



Your background



 * Experience: You boast a proven track record with 8+ years of experience in business development, sales, and client acquisition within the professional services and enterprise data solutions domain. You've conquered complex sales cycles and have a portfolio showcasing successful enterprise deals.
 * Industry Know-How: You're well-versed in data and the latest trends, data technologies, and challenges faced by enterprises.
 * Network and Relationships: Leveraging your extensive network, you've established robust relationships with C-level executives and decision-makers in various enterprises. You're adept at navigating organisational structures and understand how to tailor your approach to different stakeholders.
 * Sales Strategy Expertise: You excel at developing and executing comprehensive business development strategies that align with organisational goals. You have a proven ability to identify market opportunities, set clear objectives, and drive initiatives that result in revenue growth and market expansion.



'Please note that we can only consider applications from individuals with the legal right to work in the country specified in the job listing. Unless otherwise stated.'

Benefits



About Simple Machines

Simple Machines isn’t your typical tech company. Rather, we’re a firm of passionate and talented expert consultants that are as much a community as a company.



When we set out to make a difference nearly 10 years ago, we did so because we weren’t happy with the status quo of technology consultancies. We wanted to build a company we would want to hire ourselves. And we’ve done just that.



At the core of our company is a team of talented individuals, many of whom are at the top of their field. We regularly present at local and international conferences, committing to many of the open-source projects we utilise in our day-to-day engagements and release many other projects back to the broader technology community.



Apply now and let’s see where the connection takes us.



Benefits - Working at Simple Machines

We’re looking for someone who’s as passionate as we are about building a world-class company.

Just some of the benefits of working with Simple Machines include:

 * Flexible working: Leave early to pick up the kids? Need to start early some days, later others? No problem
 * Generous parental leave: Three months fully paid primary carer leave and one month fully paid secondary carer leave, subject to a minimum 12-month tenure
 * Learning and development: We all love continually learning and have a generous budget for you to upskill, join conferences, get certified and qualified.
 * Lunch is on us. Always! We happily supply lunch at each of our office locations every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday.

Data Analytics Engineer - Sydney Office - Permanent Full Time


A great opportunity for a Data Analytics Engineer, in the Data Decision Science team, you will work in a cross-functional data, commercial, strategy and technology team to build new data products and insights in our property marketplace. You will carry out design, implement, deploy, test and maintain data pipelines. Moreover conducting data analysis, maintaining metrics and visualising data is part of the main areas.


Who are you?

The ideal candidate will…

 * Data Analytics Engineer is responsible for developing new or enhancing current data models. Expecting to employ bespoke practices to design, implement and deliver clean datasets that fits the evolving needs of business.

 * Ability to properly communicate with stakeholders and translate business requirements to data analytics problem definition.

 * You will work directly with data decision science teams, ML and data engineers as well as business users from Commercial, Strategy, Marketing, Product and Tech. You have also demonstrated a track record in conceptualising and deploying similar projects that have delivered real business results.

 * Ability to plan and handle project execution.

 * Present information using data visualisation techniques (preferably Tableau).

 * Good Understanding of computer science fundamentals including data structures, algorithms, and concurrency.

 * You keep up to date with the latest research, trends and best practices in data analytics engineering.


Attributes

 * Data processing and analytics skills such as data visualisation, data modelling, data cleaning and validations.

 * 3 to 5 years of relevant commercial experience with a detailed understanding of scoping, designing, implementing and deploying data pipelines using orchestration tools preferably Airflow and DBT.

 * Proven experience of building insightful datasets.

 * Excellent in SQL.

 * Proficient in applying version control, testing and similar concepts to prepare new data models.

 * Proficient in code development with Python (Scala or Java is a plus). Knowledge of python data science libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, etc is a plus.

 * Proficient in data visualisations (Preferably Tableau)

 * Experienced working with massive amounts of user behaviour data is a plus.

 * Experience working with Docker, GitHub actions, AWS, GCP or Azure ecosystem with strong preference for AWS.

 * Knowledge of Linear Algebra, Probability Theory, Statistics, Calculus and Optimization is a plus.

 * Skills in Apache Spark or MapReduce are plus.


Why join us?

We’re the right size business for you to make a real impact, with a workplace culture where you can be you. Perks of the role include:

 * Discover your ideal work-life balance with our approach to flexibility – whether it's adjusted hours or making the most of working remotely and from our offices, let's chat about what works best for you;

 * First-rate parental leave and wellbeing policies;

 * Access to Perkbox, giving you discounts across healthcare, entertainment, food, utilities and more

 * Continuous opportunities to leap, learn and grow.


We don’t just talk, we do. Every day we solve property problems for Australians and beyond. We encourage our people to see the possibilities, and turn them into realities. That’s why we want you.


Who are we?

We shine a light on all things property. Our business aims to simplify the property journey for all involved; motivated by expertise and our exclusive data.

Changing the way people engage with property requires a team of diverse thinkers.


What’s next?

One of our talent partners will give your application a good look and give you a call if it’s a good match, so apply now!


Don’t meet every single requirement? We’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse and supportive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to send in your application. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within the Domain Group.

Neara is a high-growth, venture-backed Series B, tech company headquartered in Sydney. We work with 75% of the utilities in Australia and New Zealand and are growing rapidly across the US and Europe. Our mission is to revolutionise the utilities industry by helping them future-proof their infrastructure and navigate the challenges of the clean energy transition. Our 3D digital network model enables utilities to simulate various scenarios and make informed decisions to protect their assets and communities.

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will create optimised, state of the art 3D graphical user interfaces and build physics simulation engines that scale across millions of assets.

Some of the things you will contribute to:

 * Developing approaches to generate accurate models from imperfect data using deep learning and classical algorithms
 * Developing approaches for intelligent network scale insights
 * Developing and optimize training pipelines
 * Developing data structures that can perform in real-time with user interaction on large underlying data sets
 * Working with a variety of data sources, including LiDAR, aerial photography & photogrammetry, and structured data.
 * Putting your software engineering skills to the test in organising functionality for many use cases in a complex domain (this is not an "on click button, send RPC" kind of application)
 * Mentoring other engineers in best practices

Some attributes we highly regard:

 * Background in software development and machine learning coupled
 * You have a superb working knowledge of Python and C++ (Java is a plus).
 * Most of all, you're passionate about Machine Learning and building best-in-class, complex software solutions.
 * An expert in Deep Learning and can bring new ideas to the business on how best to solve our customers' unique problems in our software platform.

Some of the benefits we have on offer:

 * Competitive salary
 * Meaningful ESOP
 * Fully Flexible Work Environment. We have a fully stocked office (and impressive snack collection) in Redfern.
 * Regular office events
 * The real benefit is working on a genuinely complex, innovative and industry leading product making a genuine difference in the world around us

To apply, please use the online application link below. Neara values diversity, belonging and equal employment opportunities. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply. We will endeavour to give you an update on your application within 7-10 working days.

Please note, you will require current and unrestricted working rights to be considered for the role. Unfortunately we are not in a position to offer visa sponsorship at this time.


** No agencies or third party service providers please **


Questions? Email talent@neara.com.

* Challenge yourself & add significant value to the Qantas Group
 * Shape and support the ongoing development of Qantas’s Data Science capability in Workforce Services and Crew Optimisation
 * Full-time Permanent opportunity based at our Mascot Campus


At Qantas, we represent Australia to the world. Our diverse country is known for its unique spirit, mateship, and a can-do attitude. Together we’re strong and resilient, and we work hard to make sure we’re always at our best.

Technology is a big part of how we continue to pioneer our way forward. Together we’ll show you it’s possible to make an impact, and to never underestimate what you’re capable of achieving.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be a thought leader in the research, development and deployment of forecasting and optimisation capabilities across Group Workforce Services.

In this role you will identify improvement opportunities through the development of mathematical modelling and optimisation capabilities and translate modelling and optimisation capabilities to workforce decision making. You will use analytical techniques to understand workforce operations and behaviours to enable development of effective crew reserve utilisation predictive modelling to improve OTP and operational coverage.

Your main responsibilities will include:
 * Work in conjunction with data engineering to have modelled outputs productionised at scale
 * Use advanced modelling techniques to understand the drivers of key business outcomes (planned vs actuals, disruption)
 * Working with business teams to create effective business cases based on key insights for transformational change to processes, or enterprise agreements
 * Simplifying complex data and analytics into meaningful and understandable insights for the business
 * Training and mentoring of partner reporting/analytical teams in use of workforce data
 * Evaluate, trialling and making recommendations of new tools and technologies
 * Supporting knowledge management across the broader data and analytical teams including Group Ops Insights, Operational Planning & People Services.


You’ll have:
 * A tertiary degree in applied statistics, mathemathics, economics, computer science or a related analytical field.
 * Extensive knowledge with Teradata or Cloud platforms is desired
 * In-depth knowledge of multivariate analysis, generalized linear models, tree-based classification models, neural networks and other modern data mining and predictive modelling techniques
 * Extensive experience utilising one or more open source programming languages e.g., R, Python, Java, C+
 * Experience in cloud computing and cluster utilisation preferred
 * Experience in extracting and manipulating large volumes of data with SQL
 * Experience in airline or large workforce management fields advantageous
 * Strong team collaboration skills to deliver high quality work and contribute to team success
 * Capable of managing and prioritising a number of competing tasks for different stakeholders
 * Excellent organisational and communication skills - both written and verbal.
 * Self-motivated and pro-active attitude.
 * Strategic thinking and planning skills
 * Ability to comply with Corporate Occupational Health and Safety Responsibilities Standard
 * Supporting business development
 * Client strategy development and implementation
 * Project management skills
 * People management experience and mentoring talented colleagues preferred


Applications will close on the 1st of March 2023

Why Qantas?
You’ll join a team where creativity and passion are encouraged. Our people come together to allow us to dream big and deliver successfully.
There are many different opportunities across our team, which means you’ll be able to grow both personally and professionally at Qantas. Your development is a priority for us – so that you can maintain the high standards our customers have come to expect and can continue to develop over time. You’ll be supported from day 1 with on the job training and coaching as well as our formal training opportunities. While you may start in this role, we’ve got a great track record of supporting our people to take their career in so many different directions, the destinations are endless.

The Qantas employee benefits program offers amazing benefits that extend well beyond travel.
 * We love to travel: Enjoy heavily discounted air travel within Australia and across the globe, both for you and your family and friends, as well as exclusive deals on accommodation and holidays.
 * We have flexible leave options: Make use of leave and flexible working opportunities including 18 weeks paid parental leave and the option to purchase additional paid leave for eligible employees.
 * We’ll give you access to thousands of rewards: Through our partnerships we can offer you discounts across shopping, food and wine, insurance, health and wellbeing, leisure and entertainment. You can also take advantage of our salary packaging program including motor vehicles, eligible portable electronic devices and professional memberships.
 * We’ll support your wellbeing: Whether it’s learning to better support your own and others’ mental health, our interactive wellbeing app or your very own tailored nutrition plan.
 * A key benefit of working for Qantas is the opportunity to create and shape your career. Learn from the people around you and put your hand up for challenging projects, all while developing yourself into a better version of you.
 * Qantas is an equal opportunity employer, so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of an organisation that encourages diversity, supports charities and environmental initiatives. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds to apply.

job_title: PhD Project – Supervised and knowledge-guided machine learning approaches for quantifying and identifying microorganisms in water and wastewater treatment
job_description:
PHD PROJECT – SUPERVISED AND KNOWLEDGE-GUIDED MACHINE LEARNING APPROACHES FOR QUANTIFYING AND IDENTIFYING MICROORGANISMS IN WATER AND WASTEWATER TREATMENT

Job No.: 648559

Location: Clayton campus

Employment Type: Full-time

Duration: 3.5-year fixed-term appointment

Remuneration: $30,000 p.a 3.5 years full-time rate (pro-rata) 2023 rate

A full scholarship is available for a PhD student to conduct research on development of fluorescence-based methods, flow cytometry, automated cell imagery, and artificial intelligence for identifying and quantifying microorganisms for large scale testing at target treatment trains. The research will be conducted in Dr Arash Zamyadi’s group (within Environmental and Public Health Microbiology Laboratories, Living Lab) in the Department of Civil Engineering, in collaboration with other research groups at Monash, national research institutes and overseas, and Australian water industry including Melbourne Water and Water Research Australia.

Assessment of water and wastewater treatment efficacy will require extensive analysis of microbial viability and microbial quantification/taxonomic identification. Cell viability assessment capabilities will require development of fluorescence-based methods. Novel quantification/identification capabilities will be developed using automated analysis with cell imagery, flow cytometry and artificial intelligence for large scale testing at target treatment trains (including but not limited to treatment technologies that manage algal blooms). This project hypothesises that a supervised and knowledge-guided machine learning approach can be used to identify microbes accurately and rapidly within manufactured water samples using different analytical platforms (optical microscopy, fluorescence microscopy and imaging flow cytometry). The PhD project objectives are to explore (1) fluorescence-based approaches for determining microbial viability and activity in water and wastewater, and (2) machine learning approaches for quantifying and identifying microorganisms.

A strong background in environmental microbiology, experience in using fluorescence-based methods, and flow cytometry is essential. Additional experience in cell imagery, coding and artificial intelligence is required. Applicants must show excellent communication and inter-personal skills, and the ability to conduct self-motivated research. They should have research-based Honours or Masters Degree (or equivalent) in the relevant research areas and have a record of publishing their research in mainstream scientific journals.

Note: applicants who already hold a PhD will not be considered.

Shortlisted candidates will be interviewed, over Zoom if necessary. The interviews will be conducted in English.

Candidate Requirements

Applicants will be considered provided that they fulfil the criteria for PhD admission at Monash University and demonstrate excellent research capability. Details of the relevant requirements are available at www.monash.edu/graduate-research/future-students/apply.

Expression of Interest

Please submit this Expression of Interest (EOI) form forms.gle/Mxj9cfzzcUCiAekT6, preferably in the form of a single PDF attachment.

EOIs shall comprise

 * A cover letter that includes a brief statement of the applicant's suitability
 * A curriculum vitae, including a list of published works
 * A full statement of academic record, supported by scanned copies of relevant certified documentation
 * Contact details of two academic referees
 * Evidence of English-language proficiency (international applicants only)

Enquiries

Dr Arash Zamyadi, Senior Lecturer, Civil Engineering, arash.zamyadi@monash.edu

Closing Date

Applications will close once a suitable candidate has been identified

Supporting a diverse workforce
